      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>

      <title>Much Ado about Nothing</title>
   </head>

      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>Much Ado about Nothing</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">

               </p>

                           </span>

            </div>
         </div>
         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DON PEDRO, prince of Arragon.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DON JOHN, his bastard brother.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CLAUDIO, a young lord of Florence.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BENEDICK, a young lord of Padua.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LEONATO, governor of Messina.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ANTONIO, his brother.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BALTHASAR, attendant on Don Pedro.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">CONRADE</span>
                        <span class="personname">BORACHIO</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">followers of Don John.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">FRIAR FRANCIS</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DOGBERRY, a constable.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">VERGES, a headborough.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Sexton.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Boy.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HERO, daughter to Leonato.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BEATRICE, niece to Leonato.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">MARGARET</span>
                        <span class="personname">URSULA</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">gentlewomen attending on Hero.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Messengers, Watch, Attendants, &c. </span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  Messina.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Before LEONATO'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Before LEONATO'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LEONATO, HERO, and BEATRICE, with a
Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">I learn in this letter that Don Peter of Arragon</div>
                     <div class="line">comes this night to Messina.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">He is very near by this: he was not three leagues off</div>
                     <div class="line">when I left him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">How many gentlemen have you lost in this action?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">But few of any sort, and none of name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">A victory is twice itself when the achiever brings</div>
                     <div class="line">home full numbers. I find here that Don Peter hath</div>
                     <div class="line">bestowed much honour on a young Florentine called Claudio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Much deserved on his part and equally remembered by</div>
                     <div class="line">Don Pedro: he hath borne himself beyond the</div>
                     <div class="line">promise of his age, doing, in the figure of a lamb,</div>
                     <div class="line">the feats of a lion: he hath indeed better</div>
                     <div class="line">bettered expectation than you must expect of me to</div>
                     <div class="line">tell you how.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath an uncle here in Messina will be very much</div>
                     <div class="line">glad of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">I have already delivered him letters, and there</div>
                     <div class="line">appears much joy in him; even so much that joy could</div>
                     <div class="line">not show itself modest enough without a badge of</div>
                     <div class="line">bitterness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Did he break out into tears?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">In great measure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">A kind overflow of kindness: there are no faces</div>
                     <div class="line">truer than those that are so washed. How much</div>
                     <div class="line">better is it to weep at joy than to joy at weeping!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, is Signior Mountanto returned from the</div>
                     <div class="line">wars or no?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">I know none of that name, lady: there was none such</div>
                     <div class="line">in the army of any sort.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">What is he that you ask for, niece?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                     <div class="line">My cousin means Signior Benedick of Padua.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">O, he's returned; and as pleasant as ever he was.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">He set up his bills here in Messina and challenged</div>
                     <div class="line">Cupid at the flight; and my uncle's fool, reading</div>
                     <div class="line">the challenge, subscribed for Cupid, and challenged</div>
                     <div class="line">him at the bird-bolt. I pray you, how many hath he</div>
                     <div class="line">killed and eaten in these wars? But how many hath</div>
                     <div class="line">he killed? for indeed I promised to eat all of his killing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, niece, you tax Signior Benedick too much;</div>
                     <div class="line">but he'll be meet with you, I doubt it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath done good service, lady, in these wars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">You had musty victual, and he hath holp to eat it:</div>
                     <div class="line">he is a very valiant trencherman; he hath an</div>
                     <div class="line">excellent stomach.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">And a good soldier too, lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">And a good soldier to a lady: but what is he to a lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">A lord to a lord, a man to a man; stuffed with all</div>
                     <div class="line">honourable virtues.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">It is so, indeed; he is no less than a stuffed man:</div>
                     <div class="line">but for the stuffing,--well, we are all mortal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">You must not, sir, mistake my niece. There is a</div>
                     <div class="line">kind of merry war betwixt Signior Benedick and her:</div>
                     <div class="line">they never meet but there's a skirmish of wit</div>
                     <div class="line">between them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas! he gets nothing by that. In our last</div>
                     <div class="line">conflict four of his five wits went halting off, and</div>
                     <div class="line">now is the whole man governed with one: so that if</div>
                     <div class="line">he have wit enough to keep himself warm, let him</div>
                     <div class="line">bear it for a difference between himself and his</div>
                     <div class="line">horse; for it is all the wealth that he hath left,</div>
                     <div class="line">to be known a reasonable creature. Who is his</div>
                     <div class="line">companion now? He hath every month a new sworn brother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't possible?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Very easily possible: he wears his faith but as</div>
                     <div class="line">the fashion of his hat; it ever changes with the</div>
                     <div class="line">next block.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">I see, lady, the gentleman is not in your books.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">No; an he were, I would burn my study. But, I pray</div>
                     <div class="line">you, who is his companion? Is there no young</div>
                     <div class="line">squarer now that will make a voyage with him to the devil?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">He is most in the company of the right noble Claudio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord, he will hang upon him like a disease: he</div>
                     <div class="line">is sooner caught than the pestilence, and the taker</div>
                     <div class="line">runs presently mad. God help the noble Claudio! if</div>
                     <div class="line">he have caught the Benedick, it will cost him a</div>
                     <div class="line">thousand pound ere a' be cured.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">I will hold friends with you, lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Do, good friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">You will never run mad, niece.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, not till a hot January.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Don Pedro is approached.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DON PEDRO, DON JOHN, CLAUDIO, BENEDICK,
and BALTHASAR</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Signior Leonato, you are come to meet your</div>
                     <div class="line">trouble: the fashion of the world is to avoid</div>
                     <div class="line">cost, and you encounter it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Never came trouble to my house in the likeness of</div>
                     <div class="line">your grace: for trouble being gone, comfort should</div>
                     <div class="line">remain; but when you depart from me, sorrow abides</div>
                     <div class="line">and happiness takes his leave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">You embrace your charge too willingly. I think this</div>
                     <div class="line">is your daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Her mother hath many times told me so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Were you in doubt, sir, that you asked her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Benedick, no; for then were you a child.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">You have it full, Benedick: we may guess by this</div>
                     <div class="line">what you are, being a man. Truly, the lady fathers</div>
                     <div class="line">herself. Be happy, lady; for you are like an</div>
                     <div class="line">honourable father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">If Signior Leonato be her father, she would not</div>
                     <div class="line">have his head on her shoulders for all Messina, as</div>
                     <div class="line">like him as she is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">I wonder that you will still be talking, Signior</div>
                     <div class="line">Benedick: nobody marks you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">What, my dear Lady Disdain! are you yet living?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it possible disdain should die while she hath</div>
                     <div class="line">such meet food to feed it as Signior Benedick?</div>
                     <div class="line">Courtesy itself must convert to disdain, if you come</div>
                     <div class="line">in her presence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then is courtesy a turncoat. But it is certain I</div>
                     <div class="line">am loved of all ladies, only you excepted: and I</div>
                     <div class="line">would I could find in my heart that I had not a hard</div>
                     <div class="line">heart; for, truly, I love none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">A dear happiness to women: they would else have</div>
                     <div class="line">been troubled with a pernicious suitor. I thank God</div>
                     <div class="line">and my cold blood, I am of your humour for that: I</div>
                     <div class="line">had rather hear my dog bark at a crow than a man</div>
                     <div class="line">swear he loves me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">God keep your ladyship still in that mind! so some</div>
                     <div class="line">gentleman or other shall 'scape a predestinate</div>
                     <div class="line">scratched face.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Scratching could not make it worse, an 'twere such</div>
                     <div class="line">a face as yours were.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, you are a rare parrot-teacher.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">A bird of my tongue is better than a beast of yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I would my horse had the speed of your tongue, and</div>
                     <div class="line">so good a continuer. But keep your way, i' God's</div>
                     <div class="line">name; I have done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">You always end with a jade's trick: I know you of old.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">That is the sum of all, Leonato. Signior Claudio</div>
                     <div class="line">and Signior Benedick, my dear friend Leonato hath</div>
                     <div class="line">invited you all. I tell him we shall stay here at</div>
                     <div class="line">the least a month; and he heartily prays some</div>
                     <div class="line">occasion may detain us longer. I dare swear he is no</div>
                     <div class="line">hypocrite, but prays from his heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">If you swear, my lord, you shall not be forsworn.</div>
                     <p>To DON JOHN</p>
                     <div class="line">Let me bid you welcome, my lord: being reconciled to</div>
                     <div class="line">the prince your brother, I owe you all duty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you: I am not of many words, but I thank</div>
                     <div class="line">you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Please it your grace lead on?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Your hand, Leonato; we will go together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all except BENEDICK and CLAUDIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Benedick, didst thou note the daughter of Signior Leonato?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I noted her not; but I looked on her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Is she not a modest young lady?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you question me, as an honest man should do, for</div>
                     <div class="line">my simple true judgment; or would you have me speak</div>
                     <div class="line">after my custom, as being a professed tyrant to their sex?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">No; I pray thee speak in sober judgment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, i' faith, methinks she's too low for a high</div>
                     <div class="line">praise, too brown for a fair praise and too little</div>
                     <div class="line">for a great praise: only this commendation I can</div>
                     <div class="line">afford her, that were she other than she is, she</div>
                     <div class="line">were unhandsome; and being no other but as she is, I</div>
                     <div class="line">do not like her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou thinkest I am in sport: I pray thee tell me</div>
                     <div class="line">truly how thou likest her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Would you buy her, that you inquire after her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Can the world buy such a jewel?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, and a case to put it into. But speak you this</div>
                     <div class="line">with a sad brow? or do you play the flouting Jack,</div>
                     <div class="line">to tell us Cupid is a good hare-finder and Vulcan a</div>
                     <div class="line">rare carpenter? Come, in what key shall a man take</div>
                     <div class="line">you, to go in the song?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">In mine eye she is the sweetest lady that ever I</div>
                     <div class="line">looked on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I can see yet without spectacles and I see no such</div>
                     <div class="line">matter: there's her cousin, an she were not</div>
                     <div class="line">possessed with a fury, exceeds her as much in beauty</div>
                     <div class="line">as the first of May doth the last of December. But I</div>
                     <div class="line">hope you have no intent to turn husband, have you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I would scarce trust myself, though I had sworn the</div>
                     <div class="line">contrary, if Hero would be my wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't come to this? In faith, hath not the world</div>
                     <div class="line">one man but he will wear his cap with suspicion?</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I never see a bachelor of three-score again?</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to, i' faith; an thou wilt needs thrust thy neck</div>
                     <div class="line">into a yoke, wear the print of it and sigh away</div>
                     <div class="line">Sundays. Look Don Pedro is returned to seek you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter DON PEDRO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">What secret hath held you here, that you followed</div>
                     <div class="line">not to Leonato's?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I would your grace would constrain me to tell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">I charge thee on thy allegiance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">You hear, Count Claudio: I can be secret as a dumb</div>
                     <div class="line">man; I would have you think so; but, on my</div>
                     <div class="line">allegiance, mark you this, on my allegiance. He is</div>
                     <div class="line">in love. With who? now that is your grace's part.</div>
                     <div class="line">Mark how short his answer is;--With Hero, Leonato's</div>
                     <div class="line">short daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">If this were so, so were it uttered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Like the old tale, my lord: 'it is not so, nor</div>
                     <div class="line">'twas not so, but, indeed, God forbid it should be</div>
                     <div class="line">so.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">If my passion change not shortly, God forbid it</div>
                     <div class="line">should be otherwise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen, if you love her; for the lady is very well worthy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You speak this to fetch me in, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, I speak my thought.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in faith, my lord, I spoke mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">And, by my two faiths and troths, my lord, I spoke mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That I love her, I feel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">That she is worthy, I know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">That I neither feel how she should be loved nor</div>
                     <div class="line">know how she should be worthy, is the opinion that</div>
                     <div class="line">fire cannot melt out of me: I will die in it at the stake.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wast ever an obstinate heretic in the despite</div>
                     <div class="line">of beauty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And never could maintain his part but in the force</div>
                     <div class="line">of his will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">That a woman conceived me, I thank her; that she</div>
                     <div class="line">brought me up, I likewise give her most humble</div>
                     <div class="line">thanks: but that I will have a recheat winded in my</div>
                     <div class="line">forehead, or hang my bugle in an invisible baldrick,</div>
                     <div class="line">all women shall pardon me. Because I will not do</div>
                     <div class="line">them the wrong to mistrust any, I will do myself the</div>
                     <div class="line">right to trust none; and the fine is, for the which</div>
                     <div class="line">I may go the finer, I will live a bachelor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall see thee, ere I die, look pale with love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">With anger, with sickness, or with hunger, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">not with love: prove that ever I lose more blood</div>
                     <div class="line">with love than I will get again with drinking, pick</div>
                     <div class="line">out mine eyes with a ballad-maker's pen and hang me</div>
                     <div class="line">up at the door of a brothel-house for the sign of</div>
                     <div class="line">blind Cupid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, if ever thou dost fall from this faith, thou</div>
                     <div class="line">wilt prove a notable argument.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">If I do, hang me in a bottle like a cat and shoot</div>
                     <div class="line">at me; and he that hits me, let him be clapped on</div>
                     <div class="line">the shoulder, and called Adam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, as time shall try: 'In time the savage bull</div>
                     <div class="line">doth bear the yoke.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">The savage bull may; but if ever the sensible</div>
                     <div class="line">Benedick bear it, pluck off the bull's horns and set</div>
                     <div class="line">them in my forehead: and let me be vilely painted,</div>
                     <div class="line">and in such great letters as they write 'Here is</div>
                     <div class="line">good horse to hire,' let them signify under my sign</div>
                     <div class="line">'Here you may see Benedick the married man.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">If this should ever happen, thou wouldst be horn-mad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, if Cupid have not spent all his quiver in</div>
                     <div class="line">Venice, thou wilt quake for this shortly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I look for an earthquake too, then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, you temporize with the hours. In the</div>
                     <div class="line">meantime, good Signior Benedick, repair to</div>
                     <div class="line">Leonato's: commend me to him and tell him I will</div>
                     <div class="line">not fail him at supper; for indeed he hath made</div>
                     <div class="line">great preparation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I have almost matter enough in me for such an</div>
                     <div class="line">embassage; and so I commit you--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">To the tuition of God: From my house, if I had it,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">The sixth of July: Your loving friend, Benedick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, mock not, mock not. The body of your</div>
                     <div class="line">discourse is sometime guarded with fragments, and</div>
                     <div class="line">the guards are but slightly basted on neither: ere</div>
                     <div class="line">you flout old ends any further, examine your</div>
                     <div class="line">conscience: and so I leave you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">My liege, your highness now may do me good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">My love is thine to teach: teach it but how,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou shalt see how apt it is to learn</div>
                     <div class="line">Any hard lesson that may do thee good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath Leonato any son, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">No child but Hero; she's his only heir.</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou affect her, Claudio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">When you went onward on this ended action,</div>
                     <div class="line">I look'd upon her with a soldier's eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">That liked, but had a rougher task in hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Than to drive liking to the name of love:</div>
                     <div class="line">But now I am return'd and that war-thoughts</div>
                     <div class="line">Have left their places vacant, in their rooms</div>
                     <div class="line">Come thronging soft and delicate desires,</div>
                     <div class="line">All prompting me how fair young Hero is,</div>
                     <div class="line">Saying, I liked her ere I went to wars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wilt be like a lover presently</div>
                     <div class="line">And tire the hearer with a book of words.</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou dost love fair Hero, cherish it,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will break with her and with her father,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou shalt have her. Was't not to this end</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou began'st to twist so fine a story?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">How sweetly you do minister to love,</div>
                     <div class="line">That know love's grief by his complexion!</div>
                     <div class="line">But lest my liking might too sudden seem,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would have salved it with a longer treatise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">What need the bridge much broader than the flood?</div>
                     <div class="line">The fairest grant is the necessity.</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, what will serve is fit: 'tis once, thou lovest,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will fit thee with the remedy.</div>
                     <div class="line">I know we shall have revelling to-night:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will assume thy part in some disguise</div>
                     <div class="line">And tell fair Hero I am Claudio,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in her bosom I'll unclasp my heart</div>
                     <div class="line">And take her hearing prisoner with the force</div>
                     <div class="line">And strong encounter of my amorous tale:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then after to her father will I break;</div>
                     <div class="line">And the conclusion is, she shall be thine.</div>
                     <div class="line">In practise let us put it presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LEONATO and ANTONIO, meeting</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, brother! Where is my cousin, your son?</div>
                     <div class="line">hath he provided this music?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">He is very busy about it. But, brother, I can tell</div>
                     <div class="line">you strange news that you yet dreamt not of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Are they good?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">As the event stamps them: but they have a good</div>
                     <div class="line">cover; they show well outward. The prince and Count</div>
                     <div class="line">Claudio, walking in a thick-pleached alley in mine</div>
                     <div class="line">orchard, were thus much overheard by a man of mine:</div>
                     <div class="line">the prince discovered to Claudio that he loved my</div>
                     <div class="line">niece your daughter and meant to acknowledge it</div>
                     <div class="line">this night in a dance: and if he found her</div>
                     <div class="line">accordant, he meant to take the present time by the</div>
                     <div class="line">top and instantly break with you of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath the fellow any wit that told you this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">A good sharp fellow: I will send for him; and</div>
                     <div class="line">question him yourself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no; we will hold it as a dream till it appear</div>
                     <div class="line">itself: but I will acquaint my daughter withal,</div>
                     <div class="line">that she may be the better prepared for an answer,</div>
                     <div class="line">if peradventure this be true. Go you and tell her of it.</div>
                     <p>Enter Attendants</p>
                     <div class="line">Cousins, you know what you have to do. O, I cry you</div>
                     <div class="line">mercy, friend; go you with me, and I will use your</div>
                     <div class="line">skill. Good cousin, have a care this busy time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DON JOHN and CONRADE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                     <div class="line">What the good-year, my lord! why are you thus out</div>
                     <div class="line">of measure sad?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no measure in the occasion that breeds;</div>
                     <div class="line">therefore the sadness is without limit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                     <div class="line">You should hear reason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">And when I have heard it, what blessing brings it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                     <div class="line">If not a present remedy, at least a patient</div>
                     <div class="line">sufferance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">I wonder that thou, being, as thou sayest thou art,</div>
                     <div class="line">born under Saturn, goest about to apply a moral</div>
                     <div class="line">medicine to a mortifying mischief. I cannot hide</div>
                     <div class="line">what I am: I must be sad when I have cause and smile</div>
                     <div class="line">at no man's jests, eat when I have stomach and wait</div>
                     <div class="line">for no man's leisure, sleep when I am drowsy and</div>
                     <div class="line">tend on no man's business, laugh when I am merry and</div>
                     <div class="line">claw no man in his humour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, but you must not make the full show of this</div>
                     <div class="line">till you may do it without controlment. You have of</div>
                     <div class="line">late stood out against your brother, and he hath</div>
                     <div class="line">ta'en you newly into his grace; where it is</div>
                     <div class="line">impossible you should take true root but by the</div>
                     <div class="line">fair weather that you make yourself: it is needful</div>
                     <div class="line">that you frame the season for your own harvest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">I had rather be a canker in a hedge than a rose in</div>
                     <div class="line">his grace, and it better fits my blood to be</div>
                     <div class="line">disdained of all than to fashion a carriage to rob</div>
                     <div class="line">love from any: in this, though I cannot be said to</div>
                     <div class="line">be a flattering honest man, it must not be denied</div>
                     <div class="line">but I am a plain-dealing villain. I am trusted with</div>
                     <div class="line">a muzzle and enfranchised with a clog; therefore I</div>
                     <div class="line">have decreed not to sing in my cage. If I had my</div>
                     <div class="line">mouth, I would bite; if I had my liberty, I would do</div>
                     <div class="line">my liking: in the meantime let me be that I am and</div>
                     <div class="line">seek not to alter me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Can you make no use of your discontent?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">I make all use of it, for I use it only.</div>
                     <div class="line">Who comes here?</div>
                     <p>Enter BORACHIO</p>
                     <div class="line">What news, Borachio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I came yonder from a great supper: the prince your</div>
                     <div class="line">brother is royally entertained by Leonato: and I</div>
                     <div class="line">can give you intelligence of an intended marriage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Will it serve for any model to build mischief on?</div>
                     <div class="line">What is he for a fool that betroths himself to</div>
                     <div class="line">unquietness?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, it is your brother's right hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Who? the most exquisite Claudio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Even he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">A proper squire! And who, and who? which way looks</div>
                     <div class="line">he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, on Hero, the daughter and heir of Leonato.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">A very forward March-chick! How came you to this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Being entertained for a perfumer, as I was smoking a</div>
                     <div class="line">musty room, comes me the prince and Claudio, hand</div>
                     <div class="line">in hand in sad conference: I whipt me behind the</div>
                     <div class="line">arras; and there heard it agreed upon that the</div>
                     <div class="line">prince should woo Hero for himself, and having</div>
                     <div class="line">obtained her, give her to Count Claudio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, let us thither: this may prove food to</div>
                     <div class="line">my displeasure. That young start-up hath all the</div>
                     <div class="line">glory of my overthrow: if I can cross him any way, I</div>
                     <div class="line">bless myself every way. You are both sure, and will assist me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                     <div class="line">To the death, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us to the great supper: their cheer is the</div>
                     <div class="line">greater that I am subdued. Would the cook were of</div>
                     <div class="line">my mind! Shall we go prove what's to be done?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll wait upon your lordship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  LEONATO'S orchard.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LEONATO, ANTONIO, HERO, BEATRICE, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Was not Count John here at supper?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw him not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">How tartly that gentleman looks! I never can see</div>
                     <div class="line">him but I am heart-burned an hour after.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                     <div class="line">He is of a very melancholy disposition.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">He were an excellent man that were made just in the</div>
                     <div class="line">midway between him and Benedick: the one is too</div>
                     <div class="line">like an image and says nothing, and the other too</div>
                     <div class="line">like my lady's eldest son, evermore tattling.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Then half Signior Benedick's tongue in Count John's</div>
                     <div class="line">mouth, and half Count John's melancholy in Signior</div>
                     <div class="line">Benedick's face,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">With a good leg and a good foot, uncle, and money</div>
                     <div class="line">enough in his purse, such a man would win any woman</div>
                     <div class="line">in the world, if a' could get her good-will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, niece, thou wilt never get thee a</div>
                     <div class="line">husband, if thou be so shrewd of thy tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">In faith, she's too curst.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Too curst is more than curst: I shall lessen God's</div>
                     <div class="line">sending that way; for it is said, 'God sends a curst</div>
                     <div class="line">cow short horns;' but to a cow too curst he sends none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">So, by being too curst, God will send you no horns.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Just, if he send me no husband; for the which</div>
                     <div class="line">blessing I am at him upon my knees every morning and</div>
                     <div class="line">evening. Lord, I could not endure a husband with a</div>
                     <div class="line">beard on his face: I had rather lie in the woollen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">You may light on a husband that hath no beard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">What should I do with him? dress him in my apparel</div>
                     <div class="line">and make him my waiting-gentlewoman? He that hath a</div>
                     <div class="line">beard is more than a youth, and he that hath no</div>
                     <div class="line">beard is less than a man: and he that is more than</div>
                     <div class="line">a youth is not for me, and he that is less than a</div>
                     <div class="line">man, I am not for him: therefore, I will even take</div>
                     <div class="line">sixpence in earnest of the bear-ward, and lead his</div>
                     <div class="line">apes into hell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, then, go you into hell?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, but to the gate; and there will the devil meet</div>
                     <div class="line">me, like an old cuckold, with horns on his head, and</div>
                     <div class="line">say 'Get you to heaven, Beatrice, get you to</div>
                     <div class="line">heaven; here's no place for you maids:' so deliver</div>
                     <div class="line">I up my apes, and away to Saint Peter for the</div>
                     <div class="line">heavens; he shows me where the bachelors sit, and</div>
                     <div class="line">there live we as merry as the day is long.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To HERO</span>  Well, niece, I trust you will be ruled</div>
                     <div class="line">by your father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, faith; it is my cousin's duty to make curtsy</div>
                     <div class="line">and say 'Father, as it please you.' But yet for all</div>
                     <div class="line">that, cousin, let him be a handsome fellow, or else</div>
                     <div class="line">make another curtsy and say 'Father, as it please</div>
                     <div class="line">me.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, niece, I hope to see you one day fitted with a husband.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Not till God make men of some other metal than</div>
                     <div class="line">earth. Would it not grieve a woman to be</div>
                     <div class="line">overmastered with a pierce of valiant dust? to make</div>
                     <div class="line">an account of her life to a clod of wayward marl?</div>
                     <div class="line">No, uncle, I'll none: Adam's sons are my brethren;</div>
                     <div class="line">and, truly, I hold it a sin to match in my kindred.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Daughter, remember what I told you: if the prince</div>
                     <div class="line">do solicit you in that kind, you know your answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">The fault will be in the music, cousin, if you be</div>
                     <div class="line">not wooed in good time: if the prince be too</div>
                     <div class="line">important, tell him there is measure in every thing</div>
                     <div class="line">and so dance out the answer. For, hear me, Hero:</div>
                     <div class="line">wooing, wedding, and repenting, is as a Scotch jig,</div>
                     <div class="line">a measure, and a cinque pace: the first suit is hot</div>
                     <div class="line">and hasty, like a Scotch jig, and full as</div>
                     <div class="line">fantastical; the wedding, mannerly-modest, as a</div>
                     <div class="line">measure, full of state and ancientry; and then comes</div>
                     <div class="line">repentance and, with his bad legs, falls into the</div>
                     <div class="line">cinque pace faster and faster, till he sink into his grave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin, you apprehend passing shrewdly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a good eye, uncle; I can see a church by daylight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">The revellers are entering, brother: make good room.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>All put on their masks</p>
               <p>Enter DON PEDRO, CLAUDIO, BENEDICK, BALTHASAR,
DON JOHN, BORACHIO, MARGARET, URSULA and others, masked</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady, will you walk about with your friend?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                     <div class="line">So you walk softly and look sweetly and say nothing,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am yours for the walk; and especially when I walk away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">With me in your company?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                     <div class="line">I may say so, when I please.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
