                     <div class="line">And when please you to say so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                     <div class="line">When I like your favour; for God defend the lute</div>
                     <div class="line">should be like the case!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">My visor is Philemon's roof; within the house is Jove.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, your visor should be thatched.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak low, if you speak love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Drawing her aside</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I would you did like me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">So would not I, for your own sake; for I have many</div>
                     <div class="line">ill-qualities.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is one?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">I say my prayers aloud.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">I love you the better: the hearers may cry, Amen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">God match me with a good dancer!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">And God keep him out of my sight when the dance is</div>
                     <div class="line">done! Answer, clerk.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">No more words: the clerk is answered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">URSULA</div>
                     <div class="line">I know you well enough; you are Signior Antonio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">At a word, I am not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">URSULA</div>
                     <div class="line">I know you by the waggling of your head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">To tell you true, I counterfeit him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">URSULA</div>
                     <div class="line">You could never do him so ill-well, unless you were</div>
                     <div class="line">the very man. Here's his dry hand up and down: you</div>
                     <div class="line">are he, you are he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">At a word, I am not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">URSULA</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, do you think I do not know you by your</div>
                     <div class="line">excellent wit? can virtue hide itself? Go to,</div>
                     <div class="line">mum, you are he: graces will appear, and there's an</div>
                     <div class="line">end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you not tell me who told you so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">No, you shall pardon me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor will you not tell me who you are?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Not now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">That I was disdainful, and that I had my good wit</div>
                     <div class="line">out of the 'Hundred Merry Tales:'--well this was</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Benedick that said so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">What's he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sure you know him well enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Not I, believe me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Did he never make you laugh?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, what is he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, he is the prince's jester: a very dull fool;</div>
                     <div class="line">only his gift is in devising impossible slanders:</div>
                     <div class="line">none but libertines delight in him; and the</div>
                     <div class="line">commendation is not in his wit, but in his villany;</div>
                     <div class="line">for he both pleases men and angers them, and then</div>
                     <div class="line">they laugh at him and beat him. I am sure he is in</div>
                     <div class="line">the fleet: I would he had boarded me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">When I know the gentleman, I'll tell him what you say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Do, do: he'll but break a comparison or two on me;</div>
                     <div class="line">which, peradventure not marked or not laughed at,</div>
                     <div class="line">strikes him into melancholy; and then there's a</div>
                     <div class="line">partridge wing saved, for the fool will eat no</div>
                     <div class="line">supper that night.</div>
                     <p>Music</p>
                     <div class="line">We must follow the leaders.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">In every good thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, if they lead to any ill, I will leave them at</div>
                     <div class="line">the next turning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dance. Then exeunt all except DON JOHN, BORACHIO,
and CLAUDIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Sure my brother is amorous on Hero and hath</div>
                     <div class="line">withdrawn her father to break with him about it.</div>
                     <div class="line">The ladies follow her and but one visor remains.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And that is Claudio: I know him by his bearing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Are not you Signior Benedick?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You know me well; I am he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior, you are very near my brother in his love:</div>
                     <div class="line">he is enamoured on Hero; I pray you, dissuade him</div>
                     <div class="line">from her: she is no equal for his birth: you may</div>
                     <div class="line">do the part of an honest man in it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">How know you he loves her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">I heard him swear his affection.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">So did I too; and he swore he would marry her to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let us to the banquet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt DON JOHN and BORACHIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus answer I in the name of Benedick,</div>
                     <div class="line">But hear these ill news with the ears of Claudio.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis certain so; the prince wooes for himself.</div>
                     <div class="line">Friendship is constant in all other things</div>
                     <div class="line">Save in the office and affairs of love:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, all hearts in love use their own tongues;</div>
                     <div class="line">Let every eye negotiate for itself</div>
                     <div class="line">And trust no agent; for beauty is a witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Against whose charms faith melteth into blood.</div>
                     <div class="line">This is an accident of hourly proof,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I mistrusted not. Farewell, therefore, Hero!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter BENEDICK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Count Claudio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, the same.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, will you go with me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Even to the next willow, about your own business,</div>
                     <div class="line">county. What fashion will you wear the garland of?</div>
                     <div class="line">about your neck, like an usurer's chain? or under</div>
                     <div class="line">your arm, like a lieutenant's scarf? You must wear</div>
                     <div class="line">it one way, for the prince hath got your Hero.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I wish him joy of her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, that's spoken like an honest drovier: so they</div>
                     <div class="line">sell bullocks. But did you think the prince would</div>
                     <div class="line">have served you thus?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, leave me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Ho! now you strike like the blind man: 'twas the</div>
                     <div class="line">boy that stole your meat, and you'll beat the post.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">If it will not be, I'll leave you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor hurt fowl! now will he creep into sedges.</div>
                     <div class="line">But that my Lady Beatrice should know me, and not</div>
                     <div class="line">know me! The prince's fool! Ha? It may be I go</div>
                     <div class="line">under that title because I am merry. Yea, but so I</div>
                     <div class="line">am apt to do myself wrong; I am not so reputed: it</div>
                     <div class="line">is the base, though bitter, disposition of Beatrice</div>
                     <div class="line">that puts the world into her person and so gives me</div>
                     <div class="line">out. Well, I'll be revenged as I may.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter DON PEDRO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, signior, where's the count? did you see him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Troth, my lord, I have played the part of Lady Fame.</div>
                     <div class="line">I found him here as melancholy as a lodge in a</div>
                     <div class="line">warren: I told him, and I think I told him true,</div>
                     <div class="line">that your grace had got the good will of this young</div>
                     <div class="line">lady; and I offered him my company to a willow-tree,</div>
                     <div class="line">either to make him a garland, as being forsaken, or</div>
                     <div class="line">to bind him up a rod, as being worthy to be whipped.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">To be whipped! What's his fault?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">The flat transgression of a schoolboy, who, being</div>
                     <div class="line">overjoyed with finding a birds' nest, shows it his</div>
                     <div class="line">companion, and he steals it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou make a trust a transgression? The</div>
                     <div class="line">transgression is in the stealer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet it had not been amiss the rod had been made,</div>
                     <div class="line">and the garland too; for the garland he might have</div>
                     <div class="line">worn himself, and the rod he might have bestowed on</div>
                     <div class="line">you, who, as I take it, have stolen his birds' nest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">I will but teach them to sing, and restore them to</div>
                     <div class="line">the owner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">If their singing answer your saying, by my faith,</div>
                     <div class="line">you say honestly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">The Lady Beatrice hath a quarrel to you: the</div>
                     <div class="line">gentleman that danced with her told her she is much</div>
                     <div class="line">wronged by you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">O, she misused me past the endurance of a block!</div>
                     <div class="line">an oak but with one green leaf on it would have</div>
                     <div class="line">answered her; my very visor began to assume life and</div>
                     <div class="line">scold with her. She told me, not thinking I had been</div>
                     <div class="line">myself, that I was the prince's jester, that I was</div>
                     <div class="line">duller than a great thaw; huddling jest upon jest</div>
                     <div class="line">with such impossible conveyance upon me that I stood</div>
                     <div class="line">like a man at a mark, with a whole army shooting at</div>
                     <div class="line">me. She speaks poniards, and every word stabs:</div>
                     <div class="line">if her breath were as terrible as her terminations,</div>
                     <div class="line">there were no living near her; she would infect to</div>
                     <div class="line">the north star. I would not marry her, though she</div>
                     <div class="line">were endowed with all that Adam bad left him before</div>
                     <div class="line">he transgressed: she would have made Hercules have</div>
                     <div class="line">turned spit, yea, and have cleft his club to make</div>
                     <div class="line">the fire too. Come, talk not of her: you shall find</div>
                     <div class="line">her the infernal Ate in good apparel. I would to God</div>
                     <div class="line">some scholar would conjure her; for certainly, while</div>
                     <div class="line">she is here, a man may live as quiet in hell as in a</div>
                     <div class="line">sanctuary; and people sin upon purpose, because they</div>
                     <div class="line">would go thither; so, indeed, all disquiet, horror</div>
                     <div class="line">and perturbation follows her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, here she comes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CLAUDIO, BEATRICE, HERO, and LEONATO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Will your grace command me any service to the</div>
                     <div class="line">world's end? I will go on the slightest errand now</div>
                     <div class="line">to the Antipodes that you can devise to send me on;</div>
                     <div class="line">I will fetch you a tooth-picker now from the</div>
                     <div class="line">furthest inch of Asia, bring you the length of</div>
                     <div class="line">Prester John's foot, fetch you a hair off the great</div>
                     <div class="line">Cham's beard, do you any embassage to the Pigmies,</div>
                     <div class="line">rather than hold three words' conference with this</div>
                     <div class="line">harpy. You have no employment for me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">None, but to desire your good company.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">O God, sir, here's a dish I love not: I cannot</div>
                     <div class="line">endure my Lady Tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, lady, come; you have lost the heart of</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Benedick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, my lord, he lent it me awhile; and I gave</div>
                     <div class="line">him use for it, a double heart for his single one:</div>
                     <div class="line">marry, once before he won it of me with false dice,</div>
                     <div class="line">therefore your grace may well say I have lost it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">You have put him down, lady, you have put him down.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">So I would not he should do me, my lord, lest I</div>
                     <div class="line">should prove the mother of fools. I have brought</div>
                     <div class="line">Count Claudio, whom you sent me to seek.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, count! wherefore are you sad?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not sad, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">How then? sick?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">The count is neither sad, nor sick, nor merry, nor</div>
                     <div class="line">well; but civil count, civil as an orange, and</div>
                     <div class="line">something of that jealous complexion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">I' faith, lady, I think your blazon to be true;</div>
                     <div class="line">though, I'll be sworn, if he be so, his conceit is</div>
                     <div class="line">false. Here, Claudio, I have wooed in thy name, and</div>
                     <div class="line">fair Hero is won: I have broke with her father,</div>
                     <div class="line">and his good will obtained: name the day of</div>
                     <div class="line">marriage, and God give thee joy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Count, take of me my daughter, and with her my</div>
                     <div class="line">fortunes: his grace hath made the match, and an</div>
                     <div class="line">grace say Amen to it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, count, 'tis your cue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Silence is the perfectest herald of joy: I were</div>
                     <div class="line">but little happy, if I could say how much. Lady, as</div>
                     <div class="line">you are mine, I am yours: I give away myself for</div>
                     <div class="line">you and dote upon the exchange.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, cousin; or, if you cannot, stop his mouth</div>
                     <div class="line">with a kiss, and let not him speak neither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">In faith, lady, you have a merry heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, my lord; I thank it, poor fool, it keeps on</div>
                     <div class="line">the windy side of care. My cousin tells him in his</div>
                     <div class="line">ear that he is in her heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And so she doth, cousin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Lord, for alliance! Thus goes every one to the</div>
                     <div class="line">world but I, and I am sunburnt; I may sit in a</div>
                     <div class="line">corner and cry heigh-ho for a husband!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady Beatrice, I will get you one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">I would rather have one of your father's getting.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath your grace ne'er a brother like you? Your</div>
                     <div class="line">father got excellent husbands, if a maid could come by them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you have me, lady?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my lord, unless I might have another for</div>
                     <div class="line">working-days: your grace is too costly to wear</div>
                     <div class="line">every day. But, I beseech your grace, pardon me: I</div>
                     <div class="line">was born to speak all mirth and no matter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Your silence most offends me, and to be merry best</div>
                     <div class="line">becomes you; for, out of question, you were born in</div>
                     <div class="line">a merry hour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, sure, my lord, my mother cried; but then there</div>
                     <div class="line">was a star danced, and under that was I born.</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousins, God give you joy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Niece, will you look to those things I told you of?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">I cry you mercy, uncle. By your grace's pardon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, a pleasant-spirited lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">There's little of the melancholy element in her, my</div>
                     <div class="line">lord: she is never sad but when she sleeps, and</div>
                     <div class="line">not ever sad then; for I have heard my daughter say,</div>
                     <div class="line">she hath often dreamed of unhappiness and waked</div>
                     <div class="line">herself with laughing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">She cannot endure to hear tell of a husband.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, by no means: she mocks all her wooers out of suit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">She were an excellent wife for Benedict.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord, my lord, if they were but a week married,</div>
                     <div class="line">they would talk themselves mad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">County Claudio, when mean you to go to church?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow, my lord: time goes on crutches till love</div>
                     <div class="line">have all his rites.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not till Monday, my dear son, which is hence a just</div>
                     <div class="line">seven-night; and a time too brief, too, to have all</div>
                     <div class="line">things answer my mind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, you shake the head at so long a breathing:</div>
                     <div class="line">but, I warrant thee, Claudio, the time shall not go</div>
                     <div class="line">dully by us. I will in the interim undertake one of</div>
                     <div class="line">Hercules' labours; which is, to bring Signior</div>
                     <div class="line">Benedick and the Lady Beatrice into a mountain of</div>
                     <div class="line">affection the one with the other. I would fain have</div>
                     <div class="line">it a match, and I doubt not but to fashion it, if</div>
                     <div class="line">you three will but minister such assistance as I</div>
                     <div class="line">shall give you direction.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I am for you, though it cost me ten</div>
                     <div class="line">nights' watchings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And I, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">And you too, gentle Hero?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                     <div class="line">I will do any modest office, my lord, to help my</div>
                     <div class="line">cousin to a good husband.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">And Benedick is not the unhopefullest husband that</div>
                     <div class="line">I know. Thus far can I praise him; he is of a noble</div>
                     <div class="line">strain, of approved valour and confirmed honesty. I</div>
                     <div class="line">will teach you how to humour your cousin, that she</div>
                     <div class="line">shall fall in love with Benedick; and I, with your</div>
                     <div class="line">two helps, will so practise on Benedick that, in</div>
                     <div class="line">despite of his quick wit and his queasy stomach, he</div>
                     <div class="line">shall fall in love with Beatrice. If we can do this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cupid is no longer an archer: his glory shall be</div>
                     <div class="line">ours, for we are the only love-gods. Go in with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">and I will tell you my drift.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DON JOHN and BORACHIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">It is so; the Count Claudio shall marry the</div>
                     <div class="line">daughter of Leonato.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, my lord; but I can cross it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Any bar, any cross, any impediment will be</div>
                     <div class="line">medicinable to me: I am sick in displeasure to him,</div>
                     <div class="line">and whatsoever comes athwart his affection ranges</div>
                     <div class="line">evenly with mine. How canst thou cross this marriage?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not honestly, my lord; but so covertly that no</div>
                     <div class="line">dishonesty shall appear in me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Show me briefly how.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I think I told your lordship a year since, how much</div>
                     <div class="line">I am in the favour of Margaret, the waiting</div>
                     <div class="line">gentlewoman to Hero.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">I remember.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I can, at any unseasonable instant of the night,</div>
                     <div class="line">appoint her to look out at her lady's chamber window.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">What life is in that, to be the death of this marriage?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">The poison of that lies in you to temper. Go you to</div>
                     <div class="line">the prince your brother; spare not to tell him that</div>
                     <div class="line">he hath wronged his honour in marrying the renowned</div>
                     <div class="line">Claudio--whose estimation do you mightily hold</div>
                     <div class="line">up--to a contaminated stale, such a one as Hero.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">What proof shall I make of that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Proof enough to misuse the prince, to vex Claudio,</div>
                     <div class="line">to undo Hero and kill Leonato. Look you for any</div>
                     <div class="line">other issue?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Only to despite them, I will endeavour any thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, then; find me a meet hour to draw Don Pedro and</div>
                     <div class="line">the Count Claudio alone: tell them that you know</div>
                     <div class="line">that Hero loves me; intend a kind of zeal both to the</div>
                     <div class="line">prince and Claudio, as,--in love of your brother's</div>
                     <div class="line">honour, who hath made this match, and his friend's</div>
                     <div class="line">reputation, who is thus like to be cozened with the</div>
                     <div class="line">semblance of a maid,--that you have discovered</div>
                     <div class="line">thus. They will scarcely believe this without trial:</div>
                     <div class="line">offer them instances; which shall bear no less</div>
                     <div class="line">likelihood than to see me at her chamber-window,</div>
                     <div class="line">hear me call Margaret Hero, hear Margaret term me</div>
                     <div class="line">Claudio; and bring them to see this the very night</div>
                     <div class="line">before the intended wedding,--for in the meantime I</div>
                     <div class="line">will so fashion the matter that Hero shall be</div>
                     <div class="line">absent,--and there shall appear such seeming truth</div>
                     <div class="line">of Hero's disloyalty that jealousy shall be called</div>
                     <div class="line">assurance and all the preparation overthrown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Grow this to what adverse issue it can, I will put</div>
                     <div class="line">it in practise. Be cunning in the working this, and</div>
                     <div class="line">thy fee is a thousand ducats.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Be you constant in the accusation, and my cunning</div>
                     <div class="line">shall not shame me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">I will presently go learn their day of marriage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  LEONATO'S orchard.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BENEDICK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Boy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Boy</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">In my chamber-window lies a book: bring it hither</div>
                     <div class="line">to me in the orchard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                     <div class="line">I am here already, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I know that; but I would have thee hence, and here again.</div>
                     <p>Exit Boy</p>
                     <div class="line">I do much wonder that one man, seeing how much</div>
                     <div class="line">another man is a fool when he dedicates his</div>
                     <div class="line">behaviors to love, will, after he hath laughed at</div>
                     <div class="line">such shallow follies in others, become the argument</div>
                     <div class="line">of his own scorn by failing in love: and such a man</div>
                     <div class="line">is Claudio. I have known when there was no music</div>
                     <div class="line">with him but the drum and the fife; and now had he</div>
                     <div class="line">rather hear the tabour and the pipe: I have known</div>
                     <div class="line">when he would have walked ten mile a-foot to see a</div>
                     <div class="line">good armour; and now will he lie ten nights awake,</div>
                     <div class="line">carving the fashion of a new doublet. He was wont to</div>
                     <div class="line">speak plain and to the purpose, like an honest man</div>
                     <div class="line">and a soldier; and now is he turned orthography; his</div>
                     <div class="line">words are a very fantastical banquet, just so many</div>
                     <div class="line">strange dishes. May I be so converted and see with</div>
                     <div class="line">these eyes? I cannot tell; I think not: I will not</div>
                     <div class="line">be sworn, but love may transform me to an oyster; but</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll take my oath on it, till he have made an oyster</div>
                     <div class="line">of me, he shall never make me such a fool. One woman</div>
                     <div class="line">is fair, yet I am well; another is wise, yet I am</div>
                     <div class="line">well; another virtuous, yet I am well; but till all</div>
                     <div class="line">graces be in one woman, one woman shall not come in</div>
                     <div class="line">my grace. Rich she shall be, that's certain; wise,</div>
                     <div class="line">or I'll none; virtuous, or I'll never cheapen her;</div>
                     <div class="line">fair, or I'll   never look on her; mild, or come not</div>
                     <div class="line">near me; noble, or not I for an angel; of good</div>
                     <div class="line">discourse, an excellent musician, and her hair shall</div>
                     <div class="line">be of what colour it please God. Ha! the prince and</div>
                     <div class="line">Monsieur Love! I will hide me in the arbour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Withdraws</p>
               <p>Enter DON PEDRO, CLAUDIO, and LEONATO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, shall we hear this music?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, my good lord. How still the evening is,</div>
                     <div class="line">As hush'd on purpose to grace harmony!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">See you where Benedick hath hid himself?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, very well, my lord: the music ended,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll fit the kid-fox with a pennyworth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BALTHASAR with Music</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Balthasar, we'll hear that song again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">O, good my lord, tax not so bad a voice</div>
                     <div class="line">To slander music any more than once.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">It is the witness still of excellency</div>
                     <div class="line">To put a strange face on his own perfection.</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, sing, and let me woo no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Because you talk of wooing, I will sing;</div>
                     <div class="line">Since many a wooer doth commence his suit</div>
                     <div class="line">To her he thinks not worthy, yet he wooes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet will he swear he loves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, pray thee, come;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if thou wilt hold longer argument,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do it in notes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Note this before my notes;</div>
                     <div class="line">There's not a note of mine that's worth the noting.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, these are very crotchets that he speaks;</div>
                     <div class="line">Note, notes, forsooth, and nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Air</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, divine air! now is his soul ravished! Is it</div>
                     <div class="line">not strange that sheeps' guts should hale souls out</div>
                     <div class="line">of men's bodies? Well, a horn for my money, when</div>
                     <div class="line">all's done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>The Song</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Sigh no more, ladies, sigh no more,</div>
                     <div class="line">Men were deceivers ever,</div>
                     <div class="line">One foot in sea and one on shore,</div>
                     <div class="line">To one thing constant never:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then sigh not so, but let them go,</div>
                     <div class="line">And be you blithe and bonny,</div>
                     <div class="line">Converting all your sounds of woe</div>
                     <div class="line">Into Hey nonny, nonny.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sing no more ditties, sing no moe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of dumps so dull and heavy;</div>
                     <div class="line">The fraud of men was ever so,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since summer first was leafy:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then sigh not so, &c.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, a good song.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">And an ill singer, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, no, no, faith; thou singest well enough for a shift.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">An he had been a dog that should have howled thus,</div>
                     <div class="line">they would have hanged him: and I pray God his bad</div>
                     <div class="line">voice bode no mischief. I had as lief have heard the</div>
                     <div class="line">night-raven, come what plague could have come after</div>
                     <div class="line">it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, marry, dost thou hear, Balthasar? I pray thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">get us some excellent music; for to-morrow night we</div>
                     <div class="line">would have it at the Lady Hero's chamber-window.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">The best I can, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Do so: farewell.</div>
                     <p>Exit BALTHASAR</p>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, Leonato. What was it you told me of</div>
                     <div class="line">to-day, that your niece Beatrice was in love with</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Benedick?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, ay: stalk on. stalk on; the fowl sits. I did</div>
                     <div class="line">never think that lady would have loved any man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">No, nor I neither; but most wonderful that she</div>
                     <div class="line">should so dote on Signior Benedick, whom she hath in</div>
                     <div class="line">all outward behaviors seemed ever to abhor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't possible? Sits the wind in that corner?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, my lord, I cannot tell what to think</div>
                     <div class="line">of it but that she loves him with an enraged</div>
                     <div class="line">affection: it is past the infinite of thought.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">May be she doth but counterfeit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, like enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">O God, counterfeit! There was never counterfeit of</div>
                     <div class="line">passion came so near the life of passion as she</div>
                     <div class="line">discovers it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what effects of passion shows she?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Bait the hook well; this fish will bite.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">What effects, my lord? She will sit you, you heard</div>
                     <div class="line">my daughter tell you how.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">She did, indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">How, how, pray you? You amaze me: I would have I</div>
                     <div class="line">thought her spirit had been invincible against all</div>
                     <div class="line">assaults of affection.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">I would have sworn it had, my lord; especially</div>
                     <div class="line">against Benedick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I should think this a gull, but that the</div>
                     <div class="line">white-bearded fellow speaks it: knavery cannot,</div>
                     <div class="line">sure, hide himself in such reverence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath ta'en the infection: hold it up.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath she made her affection known to Benedick?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">No; and swears she never will: that's her torment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis true, indeed; so your daughter says: 'Shall</div>
                     <div class="line">I,' says she, 'that have so oft encountered him</div>
                     <div class="line">with scorn, write to him that I love him?'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">This says she now when she is beginning to write to</div>
                     <div class="line">him; for she'll be up twenty times a night, and</div>
                     <div class="line">there will she sit in her smock till she have writ a</div>
                     <div class="line">sheet of paper: my daughter tells us all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Now you talk of a sheet of paper, I remember a</div>
                     <div class="line">pretty jest your daughter told us of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, when she had writ it and was reading it over, she</div>
                     <div class="line">found Benedick and Beatrice between the sheet?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, she tore the letter into a thousand halfpence;</div>
                     <div class="line">railed at herself, that she should be so immodest</div>
                     <div class="line">to write to one that she knew would flout her; 'I</div>
                     <div class="line">measure him,' says she, 'by my own spirit; for I</div>
                     <div class="line">should flout him, if he writ to me; yea, though I</div>
                     <div class="line">love him, I should.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Then down upon her knees she falls, weeps, sobs,</div>
                     <div class="line">beats her heart, tears her hair, prays, curses; 'O</div>
                     <div class="line">sweet Benedick! God give me patience!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">She doth indeed; my daughter says so: and the</div>
                     <div class="line">ecstasy hath so much overborne her that my daughter</div>
                     <div class="line">is sometime afeared she will do a desperate outrage</div>
                     <div class="line">to herself: it is very true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">It were good that Benedick knew of it by some</div>
                     <div class="line">other, if she will not discover it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">To what end? He would make but a sport of it and</div>
                     <div class="line">torment the poor lady worse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">An he should, it were an alms to hang him. She's an</div>
                     <div class="line">excellent sweet lady; and, out of all suspicion,</div>
                     <div class="line">she is virtuous.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And she is exceeding wise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">In every thing but in loving Benedick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, my lord, wisdom and blood combating in so tender</div>
                     <div class="line">a body, we have ten proofs to one that blood hath</div>
                     <div class="line">the victory. I am sorry for her, as I have just</div>
                     <div class="line">cause, being her uncle and her guardian.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">I would she had bestowed this dotage on me: I would</div>
                     <div class="line">have daffed all other respects and made her half</div>
                     <div class="line">myself. I pray you, tell Benedick of it, and hear</div>
                     <div class="line">what a' will say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Were it good, think you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hero thinks surely she will die; for she says she</div>
                     <div class="line">will die, if he love her not, and she will die, ere</div>
                     <div class="line">she make her love known, and she will die, if he woo</div>
                     <div class="line">her, rather than she will bate one breath of her</div>
                     <div class="line">accustomed crossness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">She doth well: if she should make tender of her</div>
                     <div class="line">love, 'tis very possible he'll scorn it; for the</div>
                     <div class="line">man, as you know all, hath a contemptible spirit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">He is a very proper man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath indeed a good outward happiness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Before God! and, in my mind, very wise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">He doth indeed show some sparks that are like wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And I take him to be valiant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
