                     <div class="line">Withdraw into a chamber by yourselves,</div>
                     <div class="line">And when I send for you, come hither mask'd.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt Ladies</p>
                     <div class="line">The prince and Claudio promised by this hour</div>
                     <div class="line">To visit me. You know your office, brother:</div>
                     <div class="line">You must be father to your brother's daughter</div>
                     <div class="line">And give her to young Claudio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I will do with confirm'd countenance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Friar, I must entreat your pains, I think.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">To do what, signior?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">To bind me, or undo me; one of them.</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Leonato, truth it is, good signior,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your niece regards me with an eye of favour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">That eye my daughter lent her: 'tis most true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">And I do with an eye of love requite her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">The sight whereof I think you had from me,</div>
                     <div class="line">From Claudio and the prince: but what's your will?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Your answer, sir, is enigmatical:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, for my will, my will is your good will</div>
                     <div class="line">May stand with ours, this day to be conjoin'd</div>
                     <div class="line">In the state of honourable marriage:</div>
                     <div class="line">In which, good friar, I shall desire your help.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">My heart is with your liking.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">And my help.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes the prince and Claudio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DON PEDRO and CLAUDIO, and two or
three others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow to this fair assembly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, prince; good morrow, Claudio:</div>
                     <div class="line">We here attend you. Are you yet determined</div>
                     <div class="line">To-day to marry with my brother's daughter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll hold my mind, were she an Ethiope.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Call her forth, brother; here's the friar ready.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit ANTONIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, Benedick. Why, what's the matter,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you have such a February face,</div>
                     <div class="line">So full of frost, of storm and cloudiness?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I think he thinks upon the savage bull.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tush, fear not, man; we'll tip thy horns with gold</div>
                     <div class="line">And all Europa shall rejoice at thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">As once Europa did at lusty Jove,</div>
                     <div class="line">When he would play the noble beast in love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Bull Jove, sir, had an amiable low;</div>
                     <div class="line">And some such strange bull leap'd your father's cow,</div>
                     <div class="line">And got a calf in that same noble feat</div>
                     <div class="line">Much like to you, for you have just his bleat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">For this I owe you: here comes other reckonings.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter ANTONIO, with the Ladies masked</p>
                     <div class="line">Which is the lady I must seize upon?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">This same is she, and I do give you her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then she's mine. Sweet, let me see your face.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">No, that you shall not, till you take her hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Before this friar and swear to marry her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me your hand: before this holy friar,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am your husband, if you like of me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                     <div class="line">And when I lived, I was your other wife:</div>
                     <p>Unmasking</p>
                     <div class="line">And when you loved, you were my other husband.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Another Hero!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing certainer:</div>
                     <div class="line">One Hero died defiled, but I do live,</div>
                     <div class="line">And surely as I live, I am a maid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">The former Hero! Hero that is dead!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">She died, my lord, but whiles her slander lived.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">All this amazement can I qualify:</div>
                     <div class="line">When after that the holy rites are ended,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell you largely of fair Hero's death:</div>
                     <div class="line">Meantime let wonder seem familiar,</div>
                     <div class="line">And to the chapel let us presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Soft and fair, friar. Which is Beatrice?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Unmasking</span>  I answer to that name. What is your will?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not you love me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, no; no more than reason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then your uncle and the prince and Claudio</div>
                     <div class="line">Have been deceived; they swore you did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not you love me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Troth, no; no more than reason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then my cousin Margaret and Ursula</div>
                     <div class="line">Are much deceived; for they did swear you did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">They swore that you were almost sick for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">They swore that you were well-nigh dead for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis no such matter. Then you do not love me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, truly, but in friendly recompense.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, cousin, I am sure you love the gentleman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll be sworn upon't that he loves her;</div>
                     <div class="line">For here's a paper written in his hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">A halting sonnet of his own pure brain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fashion'd to Beatrice.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                     <div class="line">And here's another</div>
                     <div class="line">Writ in my cousin's hand, stolen from her pocket,</div>
                     <div class="line">Containing her affection unto Benedick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">A miracle! here's our own hands against our hearts.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, I will have thee; but, by this light, I take</div>
                     <div class="line">thee for pity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not deny you; but, by this good day, I yield</div>
                     <div class="line">upon great persuasion; and partly to save your life,</div>
                     <div class="line">for I was told you were in a consumption.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace! I will stop your mouth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Kissing her</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                     <div class="line">How dost thou, Benedick, the married man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell thee what, prince; a college of</div>
                     <div class="line">wit-crackers cannot flout me out of my humour. Dost</div>
                     <div class="line">thou think I  care for a satire or an epigram? No:</div>
                     <div class="line">if a man will be beaten with brains, a' shall wear</div>
                     <div class="line">nothing handsome about him. In brief, since I do</div>
                     <div class="line">purpose to marry, I will think nothing to any</div>
                     <div class="line">purpose that the world can say against it; and</div>
                     <div class="line">therefore never flout at me for what I have said</div>
                     <div class="line">against it; for man is a giddy thing, and this is my</div>
                     <div class="line">conclusion. For thy part, Claudio, I did think to</div>
                     <div class="line">have beaten thee, but in that thou art like to be my</div>
                     <div class="line">kinsman, live unbruised and love my cousin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I had well hoped thou wouldst have denied Beatrice,</div>
                     <div class="line">that I might have cudgelled thee out of thy single</div>
                     <div class="line">life, to make thee a double-dealer; which, out of</div>
                     <div class="line">question, thou wilt be, if my cousin do not look</div>
                     <div class="line">exceedingly narrowly to thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, we are friends: let's have a dance ere</div>
                     <div class="line">we are married, that we may lighten our own hearts</div>
                     <div class="line">and our wives' heels.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll have dancing afterward.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">First, of my word; therefore play, music. Prince,</div>
                     <div class="line">thou art sad; get thee a wife, get thee a wife:</div>
                     <div class="line">there is no staff more reverend than one tipped with horn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, your brother John is ta'en in flight,</div>
                     <div class="line">And brought with armed men back to Messina.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Think not on him till to-morrow:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll devise thee brave punishments for him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike up, pipers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dance</p>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>

      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>

      <meta content="DocBook XSL 2.0 Stylesheets Vxxx" name="generator"/>
      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>Much Ado about Nothing</title>
   </head>
   <body>
      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>Much Ado about Nothing</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">
            <div class="toc">
               <p>
                  <b>Table of Contents</b>
               </p>
               <ul class="toc">
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.2">1. Dramatis Personae</a>
                     </span>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.3">1. ACT I</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Before LEONATO'S house.</a>
                           </span>

                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  The same.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.4">2. ACT II</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  The same.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  LEONATO'S orchard.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.5">3. ACT III</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  LEONATO'S garden.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO'S house</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.5">4. SCENE IV.  HERO's apartment.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.6">5. SCENE V.  Another room in LEONATO'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.6">4. ACT IV</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  A church.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  A prison.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.7">5. ACT V</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Before LEONATO'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  LEONATO'S garden.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  A church.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DON PEDRO, prince of Arragon.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DON JOHN, his bastard brother.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CLAUDIO, a young lord of Florence.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BENEDICK, a young lord of Padua.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LEONATO, governor of Messina.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ANTONIO, his brother.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BALTHASAR, attendant on Don Pedro.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">CONRADE</span>
                              <span class="personname">BORACHIO</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">followers of Don John.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">FRIAR FRANCIS</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DOGBERRY, a constable.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">VERGES, a headborough.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Sexton.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Boy.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">HERO, daughter to Leonato.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BEATRICE, niece to Leonato.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">MARGARET</span>
                              <span class="personname">URSULA</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">gentlewomen attending on Hero.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Messengers, Watch, Attendants, &c. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Messina.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Before LEONATO'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  The same.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Before LEONATO'S house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter LEONATO, HERO, and BEATRICE, with a
Messenger</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">I learn in this letter that Don Peter of Arragon</div>
                              <div class="line">comes this night to Messina.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">He is very near by this: he was not three leagues off</div>
                              <div class="line">when I left him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">How many gentlemen have you lost in this action?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">But few of any sort, and none of name.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">A victory is twice itself when the achiever brings</div>
                              <div class="line">home full numbers. I find here that Don Peter hath</div>
                              <div class="line">bestowed much honour on a young Florentine called Claudio.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Much deserved on his part and equally remembered by</div>
                              <div class="line">Don Pedro: he hath borne himself beyond the</div>
                              <div class="line">promise of his age, doing, in the figure of a lamb,</div>
                              <div class="line">the feats of a lion: he hath indeed better</div>
                              <div class="line">bettered expectation than you must expect of me to</div>
                              <div class="line">tell you how.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath an uncle here in Messina will be very much</div>
                              <div class="line">glad of it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">I have already delivered him letters, and there</div>
                              <div class="line">appears much joy in him; even so much that joy could</div>
                              <div class="line">not show itself modest enough without a badge of</div>
                              <div class="line">bitterness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Did he break out into tears?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">In great measure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">A kind overflow of kindness: there are no faces</div>
                              <div class="line">truer than those that are so washed. How much</div>
                              <div class="line">better is it to weep at joy than to joy at weeping!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, is Signior Mountanto returned from the</div>
                              <div class="line">wars or no?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">I know none of that name, lady: there was none such</div>
                              <div class="line">in the army of any sort.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">What is he that you ask for, niece?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                              <div class="line">My cousin means Signior Benedick of Padua.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">O, he's returned; and as pleasant as ever he was.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">He set up his bills here in Messina and challenged</div>
                              <div class="line">Cupid at the flight; and my uncle's fool, reading</div>
                              <div class="line">the challenge, subscribed for Cupid, and challenged</div>
                              <div class="line">him at the bird-bolt. I pray you, how many hath he</div>
                              <div class="line">killed and eaten in these wars? But how many hath</div>
                              <div class="line">he killed? for indeed I promised to eat all of his killing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Faith, niece, you tax Signior Benedick too much;</div>
                              <div class="line">but he'll be meet with you, I doubt it not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath done good service, lady, in these wars.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">You had musty victual, and he hath holp to eat it:</div>
                              <div class="line">he is a very valiant trencherman; he hath an</div>
                              <div class="line">excellent stomach.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">And a good soldier too, lady.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">And a good soldier to a lady: but what is he to a lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">A lord to a lord, a man to a man; stuffed with all</div>
                              <div class="line">honourable virtues.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">It is so, indeed; he is no less than a stuffed man:</div>
                              <div class="line">but for the stuffing,--well, we are all mortal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">You must not, sir, mistake my niece. There is a</div>
                              <div class="line">kind of merry war betwixt Signior Benedick and her:</div>
                              <div class="line">they never meet but there's a skirmish of wit</div>
                              <div class="line">between them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas! he gets nothing by that. In our last</div>
                              <div class="line">conflict four of his five wits went halting off, and</div>
                              <div class="line">now is the whole man governed with one: so that if</div>
                              <div class="line">he have wit enough to keep himself warm, let him</div>
                              <div class="line">bear it for a difference between himself and his</div>
                              <div class="line">horse; for it is all the wealth that he hath left,</div>
                              <div class="line">to be known a reasonable creature. Who is his</div>
                              <div class="line">companion now? He hath every month a new sworn brother.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Is't possible?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Very easily possible: he wears his faith but as</div>
                              <div class="line">the fashion of his hat; it ever changes with the</div>
                              <div class="line">next block.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">I see, lady, the gentleman is not in your books.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">No; an he were, I would burn my study. But, I pray</div>
                              <div class="line">you, who is his companion? Is there no young</div>
                              <div class="line">squarer now that will make a voyage with him to the devil?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">He is most in the company of the right noble Claudio.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">O Lord, he will hang upon him like a disease: he</div>
                              <div class="line">is sooner caught than the pestilence, and the taker</div>
                              <div class="line">runs presently mad. God help the noble Claudio! if</div>
                              <div class="line">he have caught the Benedick, it will cost him a</div>
                              <div class="line">thousand pound ere a' be cured.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">I will hold friends with you, lady.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Do, good friend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">You will never run mad, niece.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">No, not till a hot January.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Don Pedro is approached.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter DON PEDRO, DON JOHN, CLAUDIO, BENEDICK,
and BALTHASAR</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Good Signior Leonato, you are come to meet your</div>
                              <div class="line">trouble: the fashion of the world is to avoid</div>
                              <div class="line">cost, and you encounter it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Never came trouble to my house in the likeness of</div>
                              <div class="line">your grace: for trouble being gone, comfort should</div>
                              <div class="line">remain; but when you depart from me, sorrow abides</div>
                              <div class="line">and happiness takes his leave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">You embrace your charge too willingly. I think this</div>
                              <div class="line">is your daughter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Her mother hath many times told me so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Were you in doubt, sir, that you asked her?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Signior Benedick, no; for then were you a child.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">You have it full, Benedick: we may guess by this</div>
                              <div class="line">what you are, being a man. Truly, the lady fathers</div>
                              <div class="line">herself. Be happy, lady; for you are like an</div>
                              <div class="line">honourable father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">If Signior Leonato be her father, she would not</div>
                              <div class="line">have his head on her shoulders for all Messina, as</div>
                              <div class="line">like him as she is.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">I wonder that you will still be talking, Signior</div>
                              <div class="line">Benedick: nobody marks you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">What, my dear Lady Disdain! are you yet living?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Is it possible disdain should die while she hath</div>
                              <div class="line">such meet food to feed it as Signior Benedick?</div>
                              <div class="line">Courtesy itself must convert to disdain, if you come</div>
                              <div class="line">in her presence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Then is courtesy a turncoat. But it is certain I</div>
                              <div class="line">am loved of all ladies, only you excepted: and I</div>
                              <div class="line">would I could find in my heart that I had not a hard</div>
                              <div class="line">heart; for, truly, I love none.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">A dear happiness to women: they would else have</div>
                              <div class="line">been troubled with a pernicious suitor. I thank God</div>
                              <div class="line">and my cold blood, I am of your humour for that: I</div>
                              <div class="line">had rather hear my dog bark at a crow than a man</div>
                              <div class="line">swear he loves me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">God keep your ladyship still in that mind! so some</div>
                              <div class="line">gentleman or other shall 'scape a predestinate</div>
                              <div class="line">scratched face.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Scratching could not make it worse, an 'twere such</div>
                              <div class="line">a face as yours were.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, you are a rare parrot-teacher.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">A bird of my tongue is better than a beast of yours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">I would my horse had the speed of your tongue, and</div>
                              <div class="line">so good a continuer. But keep your way, i' God's</div>
                              <div class="line">name; I have done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">You always end with a jade's trick: I know you of old.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">That is the sum of all, Leonato. Signior Claudio</div>
                              <div class="line">and Signior Benedick, my dear friend Leonato hath</div>
                              <div class="line">invited you all. I tell him we shall stay here at</div>
                              <div class="line">the least a month; and he heartily prays some</div>
                              <div class="line">occasion may detain us longer. I dare swear he is no</div>
                              <div class="line">hypocrite, but prays from his heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">If you swear, my lord, you shall not be forsworn.</div>
                              <p>To DON JOHN</p>
                              <div class="line">Let me bid you welcome, my lord: being reconciled to</div>
                              <div class="line">the prince your brother, I owe you all duty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank you: I am not of many words, but I thank</div>
                              <div class="line">you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Please it your grace lead on?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Your hand, Leonato; we will go together.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all except BENEDICK and CLAUDIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Benedick, didst thou note the daughter of Signior Leonato?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">I noted her not; but I looked on her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Is she not a modest young lady?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you question me, as an honest man should do, for</div>
                              <div class="line">my simple true judgment; or would you have me speak</div>
                              <div class="line">after my custom, as being a professed tyrant to their sex?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">No; I pray thee speak in sober judgment.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, i' faith, methinks she's too low for a high</div>
                              <div class="line">praise, too brown for a fair praise and too little</div>
                              <div class="line">for a great praise: only this commendation I can</div>
                              <div class="line">afford her, that were she other than she is, she</div>
                              <div class="line">were unhandsome; and being no other but as she is, I</div>
                              <div class="line">do not like her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou thinkest I am in sport: I pray thee tell me</div>
                              <div class="line">truly how thou likest her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Would you buy her, that you inquire after her?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Can the world buy such a jewel?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, and a case to put it into. But speak you this</div>
                              <div class="line">with a sad brow? or do you play the flouting Jack,</div>
                              <div class="line">to tell us Cupid is a good hare-finder and Vulcan a</div>
                              <div class="line">rare carpenter? Come, in what key shall a man take</div>
                              <div class="line">you, to go in the song?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">In mine eye she is the sweetest lady that ever I</div>
                              <div class="line">looked on.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">I can see yet without spectacles and I see no such</div>
                              <div class="line">matter: there's her cousin, an she were not</div>
                              <div class="line">possessed with a fury, exceeds her as much in beauty</div>
                              <div class="line">as the first of May doth the last of December. But I</div>
                              <div class="line">hope you have no intent to turn husband, have you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I would scarce trust myself, though I had sworn the</div>
                              <div class="line">contrary, if Hero would be my wife.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Is't come to this? In faith, hath not the world</div>
                              <div class="line">one man but he will wear his cap with suspicion?</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall I never see a bachelor of three-score again?</div>
                              <div class="line">Go to, i' faith; an thou wilt needs thrust thy neck</div>
                              <div class="line">into a yoke, wear the print of it and sigh away</div>
                              <div class="line">Sundays. Look Don Pedro is returned to seek you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter DON PEDRO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">What secret hath held you here, that you followed</div>
                              <div class="line">not to Leonato's?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">I would your grace would constrain me to tell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">I charge thee on thy allegiance.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">You hear, Count Claudio: I can be secret as a dumb</div>
                              <div class="line">man; I would have you think so; but, on my</div>
                              <div class="line">allegiance, mark you this, on my allegiance. He is</div>
                              <div class="line">in love. With who? now that is your grace's part.</div>
                              <div class="line">Mark how short his answer is;--With Hero, Leonato's</div>
                              <div class="line">short daughter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">If this were so, so were it uttered.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Like the old tale, my lord: 'it is not so, nor</div>
                              <div class="line">'twas not so, but, indeed, God forbid it should be</div>
                              <div class="line">so.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">If my passion change not shortly, God forbid it</div>
                              <div class="line">should be otherwise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Amen, if you love her; for the lady is very well worthy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">You speak this to fetch me in, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">By my troth, I speak my thought.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in faith, my lord, I spoke mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">And, by my two faiths and troths, my lord, I spoke mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">That I love her, I feel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">That she is worthy, I know.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">That I neither feel how she should be loved nor</div>
                              <div class="line">know how she should be worthy, is the opinion that</div>
                              <div class="line">fire cannot melt out of me: I will die in it at the stake.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou wast ever an obstinate heretic in the despite</div>
                              <div class="line">of beauty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And never could maintain his part but in the force</div>
                              <div class="line">of his will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">That a woman conceived me, I thank her; that she</div>
                              <div class="line">brought me up, I likewise give her most humble</div>
                              <div class="line">thanks: but that I will have a recheat winded in my</div>
                              <div class="line">forehead, or hang my bugle in an invisible baldrick,</div>
                              <div class="line">all women shall pardon me. Because I will not do</div>
                              <div class="line">them the wrong to mistrust any, I will do myself the</div>
                              <div class="line">right to trust none; and the fine is, for the which</div>
                              <div class="line">I may go the finer, I will live a bachelor.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall see thee, ere I die, look pale with love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">With anger, with sickness, or with hunger, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">not with love: prove that ever I lose more blood</div>
                              <div class="line">with love than I will get again with drinking, pick</div>
                              <div class="line">out mine eyes with a ballad-maker's pen and hang me</div>
                              <div class="line">up at the door of a brothel-house for the sign of</div>
                              <div class="line">blind Cupid.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, if ever thou dost fall from this faith, thou</div>
                              <div class="line">wilt prove a notable argument.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">If I do, hang me in a bottle like a cat and shoot</div>
                              <div class="line">at me; and he that hits me, let him be clapped on</div>
                              <div class="line">the shoulder, and called Adam.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, as time shall try: 'In time the savage bull</div>
                              <div class="line">doth bear the yoke.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">The savage bull may; but if ever the sensible</div>
                              <div class="line">Benedick bear it, pluck off the bull's horns and set</div>
                              <div class="line">them in my forehead: and let me be vilely painted,</div>
                              <div class="line">and in such great letters as they write 'Here is</div>
                              <div class="line">good horse to hire,' let them signify under my sign</div>
                              <div class="line">'Here you may see Benedick the married man.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">If this should ever happen, thou wouldst be horn-mad.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, if Cupid have not spent all his quiver in</div>
                              <div class="line">Venice, thou wilt quake for this shortly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">I look for an earthquake too, then.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, you temporize with the hours. In the</div>
                              <div class="line">meantime, good Signior Benedick, repair to</div>
                              <div class="line">Leonato's: commend me to him and tell him I will</div>
                              <div class="line">not fail him at supper; for indeed he hath made</div>
                              <div class="line">great preparation.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">I have almost matter enough in me for such an</div>
                              <div class="line">embassage; and so I commit you--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">To the tuition of God: From my house, if I had it,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
