                              <div class="line">The sixth of July: Your loving friend, Benedick.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, mock not, mock not. The body of your</div>
                              <div class="line">discourse is sometime guarded with fragments, and</div>
                              <div class="line">the guards are but slightly basted on neither: ere</div>
                              <div class="line">you flout old ends any further, examine your</div>
                              <div class="line">conscience: and so I leave you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">My liege, your highness now may do me good.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">My love is thine to teach: teach it but how,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou shalt see how apt it is to learn</div>
                              <div class="line">Any hard lesson that may do thee good.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath Leonato any son, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">No child but Hero; she's his only heir.</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost thou affect her, Claudio?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">O, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">When you went onward on this ended action,</div>
                              <div class="line">I look'd upon her with a soldier's eye,</div>
                              <div class="line">That liked, but had a rougher task in hand</div>
                              <div class="line">Than to drive liking to the name of love:</div>
                              <div class="line">But now I am return'd and that war-thoughts</div>
                              <div class="line">Have left their places vacant, in their rooms</div>
                              <div class="line">Come thronging soft and delicate desires,</div>
                              <div class="line">All prompting me how fair young Hero is,</div>
                              <div class="line">Saying, I liked her ere I went to wars.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou wilt be like a lover presently</div>
                              <div class="line">And tire the hearer with a book of words.</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou dost love fair Hero, cherish it,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will break with her and with her father,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou shalt have her. Was't not to this end</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou began'st to twist so fine a story?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">How sweetly you do minister to love,</div>
                              <div class="line">That know love's grief by his complexion!</div>
                              <div class="line">But lest my liking might too sudden seem,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would have salved it with a longer treatise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">What need the bridge much broader than the flood?</div>
                              <div class="line">The fairest grant is the necessity.</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, what will serve is fit: 'tis once, thou lovest,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will fit thee with the remedy.</div>
                              <div class="line">I know we shall have revelling to-night:</div>
                              <div class="line">I will assume thy part in some disguise</div>
                              <div class="line">And tell fair Hero I am Claudio,</div>
                              <div class="line">And in her bosom I'll unclasp my heart</div>
                              <div class="line">And take her hearing prisoner with the force</div>
                              <div class="line">And strong encounter of my amorous tale:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then after to her father will I break;</div>
                              <div class="line">And the conclusion is, she shall be thine.</div>
                              <div class="line">In practise let us put it presently.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter LEONATO and ANTONIO, meeting</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, brother! Where is my cousin, your son?</div>
                              <div class="line">hath he provided this music?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">He is very busy about it. But, brother, I can tell</div>
                              <div class="line">you strange news that you yet dreamt not of.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Are they good?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">As the event stamps them: but they have a good</div>
                              <div class="line">cover; they show well outward. The prince and Count</div>
                              <div class="line">Claudio, walking in a thick-pleached alley in mine</div>
                              <div class="line">orchard, were thus much overheard by a man of mine:</div>
                              <div class="line">the prince discovered to Claudio that he loved my</div>
                              <div class="line">niece your daughter and meant to acknowledge it</div>
                              <div class="line">this night in a dance: and if he found her</div>
                              <div class="line">accordant, he meant to take the present time by the</div>
                              <div class="line">top and instantly break with you of it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath the fellow any wit that told you this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">A good sharp fellow: I will send for him; and</div>
                              <div class="line">question him yourself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">No, no; we will hold it as a dream till it appear</div>
                              <div class="line">itself: but I will acquaint my daughter withal,</div>
                              <div class="line">that she may be the better prepared for an answer,</div>
                              <div class="line">if peradventure this be true. Go you and tell her of it.</div>
                              <p>Enter Attendants</p>
                              <div class="line">Cousins, you know what you have to do. O, I cry you</div>
                              <div class="line">mercy, friend; go you with me, and I will use your</div>
                              <div class="line">skill. Good cousin, have a care this busy time.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  The same.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter DON JOHN and CONRADE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                              <div class="line">What the good-year, my lord! why are you thus out</div>
                              <div class="line">of measure sad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">There is no measure in the occasion that breeds;</div>
                              <div class="line">therefore the sadness is without limit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                              <div class="line">You should hear reason.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">And when I have heard it, what blessing brings it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                              <div class="line">If not a present remedy, at least a patient</div>
                              <div class="line">sufferance.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">I wonder that thou, being, as thou sayest thou art,</div>
                              <div class="line">born under Saturn, goest about to apply a moral</div>
                              <div class="line">medicine to a mortifying mischief. I cannot hide</div>
                              <div class="line">what I am: I must be sad when I have cause and smile</div>
                              <div class="line">at no man's jests, eat when I have stomach and wait</div>
                              <div class="line">for no man's leisure, sleep when I am drowsy and</div>
                              <div class="line">tend on no man's business, laugh when I am merry and</div>
                              <div class="line">claw no man in his humour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, but you must not make the full show of this</div>
                              <div class="line">till you may do it without controlment. You have of</div>
                              <div class="line">late stood out against your brother, and he hath</div>
                              <div class="line">ta'en you newly into his grace; where it is</div>
                              <div class="line">impossible you should take true root but by the</div>
                              <div class="line">fair weather that you make yourself: it is needful</div>
                              <div class="line">that you frame the season for your own harvest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather be a canker in a hedge than a rose in</div>
                              <div class="line">his grace, and it better fits my blood to be</div>
                              <div class="line">disdained of all than to fashion a carriage to rob</div>
                              <div class="line">love from any: in this, though I cannot be said to</div>
                              <div class="line">be a flattering honest man, it must not be denied</div>
                              <div class="line">but I am a plain-dealing villain. I am trusted with</div>
                              <div class="line">a muzzle and enfranchised with a clog; therefore I</div>
                              <div class="line">have decreed not to sing in my cage. If I had my</div>
                              <div class="line">mouth, I would bite; if I had my liberty, I would do</div>
                              <div class="line">my liking: in the meantime let me be that I am and</div>
                              <div class="line">seek not to alter me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                              <div class="line">Can you make no use of your discontent?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">I make all use of it, for I use it only.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who comes here?</div>
                              <p>Enter BORACHIO</p>
                              <div class="line">What news, Borachio?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I came yonder from a great supper: the prince your</div>
                              <div class="line">brother is royally entertained by Leonato: and I</div>
                              <div class="line">can give you intelligence of an intended marriage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Will it serve for any model to build mischief on?</div>
                              <div class="line">What is he for a fool that betroths himself to</div>
                              <div class="line">unquietness?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, it is your brother's right hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Who? the most exquisite Claudio?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Even he.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">A proper squire! And who, and who? which way looks</div>
                              <div class="line">he?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, on Hero, the daughter and heir of Leonato.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">A very forward March-chick! How came you to this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Being entertained for a perfumer, as I was smoking a</div>
                              <div class="line">musty room, comes me the prince and Claudio, hand</div>
                              <div class="line">in hand in sad conference: I whipt me behind the</div>
                              <div class="line">arras; and there heard it agreed upon that the</div>
                              <div class="line">prince should woo Hero for himself, and having</div>
                              <div class="line">obtained her, give her to Count Claudio.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, let us thither: this may prove food to</div>
                              <div class="line">my displeasure. That young start-up hath all the</div>
                              <div class="line">glory of my overthrow: if I can cross him any way, I</div>
                              <div class="line">bless myself every way. You are both sure, and will assist me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                              <div class="line">To the death, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us to the great supper: their cheer is the</div>
                              <div class="line">greater that I am subdued. Would the cook were of</div>
                              <div class="line">my mind! Shall we go prove what's to be done?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll wait upon your lordship.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  The same.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  LEONATO'S orchard.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter LEONATO, ANTONIO, HERO, BEATRICE, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Was not Count John here at supper?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I saw him not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">How tartly that gentleman looks! I never can see</div>
                              <div class="line">him but I am heart-burned an hour after.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                              <div class="line">He is of a very melancholy disposition.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">He were an excellent man that were made just in the</div>
                              <div class="line">midway between him and Benedick: the one is too</div>
                              <div class="line">like an image and says nothing, and the other too</div>
                              <div class="line">like my lady's eldest son, evermore tattling.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Then half Signior Benedick's tongue in Count John's</div>
                              <div class="line">mouth, and half Count John's melancholy in Signior</div>
                              <div class="line">Benedick's face,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">With a good leg and a good foot, uncle, and money</div>
                              <div class="line">enough in his purse, such a man would win any woman</div>
                              <div class="line">in the world, if a' could get her good-will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">By my troth, niece, thou wilt never get thee a</div>
                              <div class="line">husband, if thou be so shrewd of thy tongue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">In faith, she's too curst.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Too curst is more than curst: I shall lessen God's</div>
                              <div class="line">sending that way; for it is said, 'God sends a curst</div>
                              <div class="line">cow short horns;' but to a cow too curst he sends none.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">So, by being too curst, God will send you no horns.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Just, if he send me no husband; for the which</div>
                              <div class="line">blessing I am at him upon my knees every morning and</div>
                              <div class="line">evening. Lord, I could not endure a husband with a</div>
                              <div class="line">beard on his face: I had rather lie in the woollen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">You may light on a husband that hath no beard.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">What should I do with him? dress him in my apparel</div>
                              <div class="line">and make him my waiting-gentlewoman? He that hath a</div>
                              <div class="line">beard is more than a youth, and he that hath no</div>
                              <div class="line">beard is less than a man: and he that is more than</div>
                              <div class="line">a youth is not for me, and he that is less than a</div>
                              <div class="line">man, I am not for him: therefore, I will even take</div>
                              <div class="line">sixpence in earnest of the bear-ward, and lead his</div>
                              <div class="line">apes into hell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, then, go you into hell?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">No, but to the gate; and there will the devil meet</div>
                              <div class="line">me, like an old cuckold, with horns on his head, and</div>
                              <div class="line">say 'Get you to heaven, Beatrice, get you to</div>
                              <div class="line">heaven; here's no place for you maids:' so deliver</div>
                              <div class="line">I up my apes, and away to Saint Peter for the</div>
                              <div class="line">heavens; he shows me where the bachelors sit, and</div>
                              <div class="line">there live we as merry as the day is long.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To HERO</span>  Well, niece, I trust you will be ruled</div>
                              <div class="line">by your father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, faith; it is my cousin's duty to make curtsy</div>
                              <div class="line">and say 'Father, as it please you.' But yet for all</div>
                              <div class="line">that, cousin, let him be a handsome fellow, or else</div>
                              <div class="line">make another curtsy and say 'Father, as it please</div>
                              <div class="line">me.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, niece, I hope to see you one day fitted with a husband.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Not till God make men of some other metal than</div>
                              <div class="line">earth. Would it not grieve a woman to be</div>
                              <div class="line">overmastered with a pierce of valiant dust? to make</div>
                              <div class="line">an account of her life to a clod of wayward marl?</div>
                              <div class="line">No, uncle, I'll none: Adam's sons are my brethren;</div>
                              <div class="line">and, truly, I hold it a sin to match in my kindred.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Daughter, remember what I told you: if the prince</div>
                              <div class="line">do solicit you in that kind, you know your answer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">The fault will be in the music, cousin, if you be</div>
                              <div class="line">not wooed in good time: if the prince be too</div>
                              <div class="line">important, tell him there is measure in every thing</div>
                              <div class="line">and so dance out the answer. For, hear me, Hero:</div>
                              <div class="line">wooing, wedding, and repenting, is as a Scotch jig,</div>
                              <div class="line">a measure, and a cinque pace: the first suit is hot</div>
                              <div class="line">and hasty, like a Scotch jig, and full as</div>
                              <div class="line">fantastical; the wedding, mannerly-modest, as a</div>
                              <div class="line">measure, full of state and ancientry; and then comes</div>
                              <div class="line">repentance and, with his bad legs, falls into the</div>
                              <div class="line">cinque pace faster and faster, till he sink into his grave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Cousin, you apprehend passing shrewdly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">I have a good eye, uncle; I can see a church by daylight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">The revellers are entering, brother: make good room.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>All put on their masks</p>
                        <p>Enter DON PEDRO, CLAUDIO, BENEDICK, BALTHASAR,
DON JOHN, BORACHIO, MARGARET, URSULA and others, masked</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Lady, will you walk about with your friend?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                              <div class="line">So you walk softly and look sweetly and say nothing,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am yours for the walk; and especially when I walk away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">With me in your company?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                              <div class="line">I may say so, when I please.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">And when please you to say so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                              <div class="line">When I like your favour; for God defend the lute</div>
                              <div class="line">should be like the case!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">My visor is Philemon's roof; within the house is Jove.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then, your visor should be thatched.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak low, if you speak love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Drawing her aside</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, I would you did like me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">So would not I, for your own sake; for I have many</div>
                              <div class="line">ill-qualities.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Which is one?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">I say my prayers aloud.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">I love you the better: the hearers may cry, Amen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">God match me with a good dancer!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Amen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">And God keep him out of my sight when the dance is</div>
                              <div class="line">done! Answer, clerk.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">No more words: the clerk is answered.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">URSULA</div>
                              <div class="line">I know you well enough; you are Signior Antonio.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">At a word, I am not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">URSULA</div>
                              <div class="line">I know you by the waggling of your head.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">To tell you true, I counterfeit him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">URSULA</div>
                              <div class="line">You could never do him so ill-well, unless you were</div>
                              <div class="line">the very man. Here's his dry hand up and down: you</div>
                              <div class="line">are he, you are he.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">At a word, I am not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">URSULA</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, do you think I do not know you by your</div>
                              <div class="line">excellent wit? can virtue hide itself? Go to,</div>
                              <div class="line">mum, you are he: graces will appear, and there's an</div>
                              <div class="line">end.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you not tell me who told you so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">No, you shall pardon me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor will you not tell me who you are?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Not now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">That I was disdainful, and that I had my good wit</div>
                              <div class="line">out of the 'Hundred Merry Tales:'--well this was</div>
                              <div class="line">Signior Benedick that said so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">What's he?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">I am sure you know him well enough.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Not I, believe me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Did he never make you laugh?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, what is he?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, he is the prince's jester: a very dull fool;</div>
                              <div class="line">only his gift is in devising impossible slanders:</div>
                              <div class="line">none but libertines delight in him; and the</div>
                              <div class="line">commendation is not in his wit, but in his villany;</div>
                              <div class="line">for he both pleases men and angers them, and then</div>
                              <div class="line">they laugh at him and beat him. I am sure he is in</div>
                              <div class="line">the fleet: I would he had boarded me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">When I know the gentleman, I'll tell him what you say.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Do, do: he'll but break a comparison or two on me;</div>
                              <div class="line">which, peradventure not marked or not laughed at,</div>
                              <div class="line">strikes him into melancholy; and then there's a</div>
                              <div class="line">partridge wing saved, for the fool will eat no</div>
                              <div class="line">supper that night.</div>
                              <p>Music</p>
                              <div class="line">We must follow the leaders.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">In every good thing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, if they lead to any ill, I will leave them at</div>
                              <div class="line">the next turning.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Dance. Then exeunt all except DON JOHN, BORACHIO,
and CLAUDIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Sure my brother is amorous on Hero and hath</div>
                              <div class="line">withdrawn her father to break with him about it.</div>
                              <div class="line">The ladies follow her and but one visor remains.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And that is Claudio: I know him by his bearing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Are not you Signior Benedick?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">You know me well; I am he.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Signior, you are very near my brother in his love:</div>
                              <div class="line">he is enamoured on Hero; I pray you, dissuade him</div>
                              <div class="line">from her: she is no equal for his birth: you may</div>
                              <div class="line">do the part of an honest man in it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">How know you he loves her?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">I heard him swear his affection.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">So did I too; and he swore he would marry her to-night.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, let us to the banquet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt DON JOHN and BORACHIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus answer I in the name of Benedick,</div>
                              <div class="line">But hear these ill news with the ears of Claudio.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis certain so; the prince wooes for himself.</div>
                              <div class="line">Friendship is constant in all other things</div>
                              <div class="line">Save in the office and affairs of love:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, all hearts in love use their own tongues;</div>
                              <div class="line">Let every eye negotiate for itself</div>
                              <div class="line">And trust no agent; for beauty is a witch</div>
                              <div class="line">Against whose charms faith melteth into blood.</div>
                              <div class="line">This is an accident of hourly proof,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I mistrusted not. Farewell, therefore, Hero!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter BENEDICK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Count Claudio?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, the same.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, will you go with me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Whither?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Even to the next willow, about your own business,</div>
                              <div class="line">county. What fashion will you wear the garland of?</div>
                              <div class="line">about your neck, like an usurer's chain? or under</div>
                              <div class="line">your arm, like a lieutenant's scarf? You must wear</div>
                              <div class="line">it one way, for the prince hath got your Hero.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I wish him joy of her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, that's spoken like an honest drovier: so they</div>
                              <div class="line">sell bullocks. But did you think the prince would</div>
                              <div class="line">have served you thus?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, leave me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ho! now you strike like the blind man: 'twas the</div>
                              <div class="line">boy that stole your meat, and you'll beat the post.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">If it will not be, I'll leave you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, poor hurt fowl! now will he creep into sedges.</div>
                              <div class="line">But that my Lady Beatrice should know me, and not</div>
                              <div class="line">know me! The prince's fool! Ha? It may be I go</div>
                              <div class="line">under that title because I am merry. Yea, but so I</div>
                              <div class="line">am apt to do myself wrong; I am not so reputed: it</div>
                              <div class="line">is the base, though bitter, disposition of Beatrice</div>
                              <div class="line">that puts the world into her person and so gives me</div>
                              <div class="line">out. Well, I'll be revenged as I may.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter DON PEDRO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, signior, where's the count? did you see him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Troth, my lord, I have played the part of Lady Fame.</div>
                              <div class="line">I found him here as melancholy as a lodge in a</div>
                              <div class="line">warren: I told him, and I think I told him true,</div>
                              <div class="line">that your grace had got the good will of this young</div>
                              <div class="line">lady; and I offered him my company to a willow-tree,</div>
                              <div class="line">either to make him a garland, as being forsaken, or</div>
                              <div class="line">to bind him up a rod, as being worthy to be whipped.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">To be whipped! What's his fault?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">The flat transgression of a schoolboy, who, being</div>
                              <div class="line">overjoyed with finding a birds' nest, shows it his</div>
                              <div class="line">companion, and he steals it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt thou make a trust a transgression? The</div>
                              <div class="line">transgression is in the stealer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet it had not been amiss the rod had been made,</div>
                              <div class="line">and the garland too; for the garland he might have</div>
                              <div class="line">worn himself, and the rod he might have bestowed on</div>
                              <div class="line">you, who, as I take it, have stolen his birds' nest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">I will but teach them to sing, and restore them to</div>
                              <div class="line">the owner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">If their singing answer your saying, by my faith,</div>
                              <div class="line">you say honestly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">The Lady Beatrice hath a quarrel to you: the</div>
                              <div class="line">gentleman that danced with her told her she is much</div>
                              <div class="line">wronged by you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">O, she misused me past the endurance of a block!</div>
                              <div class="line">an oak but with one green leaf on it would have</div>
                              <div class="line">answered her; my very visor began to assume life and</div>
                              <div class="line">scold with her. She told me, not thinking I had been</div>
                              <div class="line">myself, that I was the prince's jester, that I was</div>
                              <div class="line">duller than a great thaw; huddling jest upon jest</div>
                              <div class="line">with such impossible conveyance upon me that I stood</div>
                              <div class="line">like a man at a mark, with a whole army shooting at</div>
                              <div class="line">me. She speaks poniards, and every word stabs:</div>
                              <div class="line">if her breath were as terrible as her terminations,</div>
                              <div class="line">there were no living near her; she would infect to</div>
                              <div class="line">the north star. I would not marry her, though she</div>
                              <div class="line">were endowed with all that Adam bad left him before</div>
                              <div class="line">he transgressed: she would have made Hercules have</div>
                              <div class="line">turned spit, yea, and have cleft his club to make</div>
                              <div class="line">the fire too. Come, talk not of her: you shall find</div>
                              <div class="line">her the infernal Ate in good apparel. I would to God</div>
                              <div class="line">some scholar would conjure her; for certainly, while</div>
                              <div class="line">she is here, a man may live as quiet in hell as in a</div>
                              <div class="line">sanctuary; and people sin upon purpose, because they</div>
                              <div class="line">would go thither; so, indeed, all disquiet, horror</div>
                              <div class="line">and perturbation follows her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, here she comes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CLAUDIO, BEATRICE, HERO, and LEONATO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Will your grace command me any service to the</div>
                              <div class="line">world's end? I will go on the slightest errand now</div>
                              <div class="line">to the Antipodes that you can devise to send me on;</div>
                              <div class="line">I will fetch you a tooth-picker now from the</div>
                              <div class="line">furthest inch of Asia, bring you the length of</div>
                              <div class="line">Prester John's foot, fetch you a hair off the great</div>
                              <div class="line">Cham's beard, do you any embassage to the Pigmies,</div>
                              <div class="line">rather than hold three words' conference with this</div>
                              <div class="line">harpy. You have no employment for me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">None, but to desire your good company.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">O God, sir, here's a dish I love not: I cannot</div>
                              <div class="line">endure my Lady Tongue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, lady, come; you have lost the heart of</div>
                              <div class="line">Signior Benedick.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Indeed, my lord, he lent it me awhile; and I gave</div>
                              <div class="line">him use for it, a double heart for his single one:</div>
                              <div class="line">marry, once before he won it of me with false dice,</div>
                              <div class="line">therefore your grace may well say I have lost it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">You have put him down, lady, you have put him down.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">So I would not he should do me, my lord, lest I</div>
                              <div class="line">should prove the mother of fools. I have brought</div>
                              <div class="line">Count Claudio, whom you sent me to seek.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, how now, count! wherefore are you sad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Not sad, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">How then? sick?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Neither, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">The count is neither sad, nor sick, nor merry, nor</div>
                              <div class="line">well; but civil count, civil as an orange, and</div>
                              <div class="line">something of that jealous complexion.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">I' faith, lady, I think your blazon to be true;</div>
                              <div class="line">though, I'll be sworn, if he be so, his conceit is</div>
                              <div class="line">false. Here, Claudio, I have wooed in thy name, and</div>
                              <div class="line">fair Hero is won: I have broke with her father,</div>
                              <div class="line">and his good will obtained: name the day of</div>
                              <div class="line">marriage, and God give thee joy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Count, take of me my daughter, and with her my</div>
                              <div class="line">fortunes: his grace hath made the match, and an</div>
                              <div class="line">grace say Amen to it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak, count, 'tis your cue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Silence is the perfectest herald of joy: I were</div>
                              <div class="line">but little happy, if I could say how much. Lady, as</div>
                              <div class="line">you are mine, I am yours: I give away myself for</div>
                              <div class="line">you and dote upon the exchange.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak, cousin; or, if you cannot, stop his mouth</div>
                              <div class="line">with a kiss, and let not him speak neither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">In faith, lady, you have a merry heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, my lord; I thank it, poor fool, it keeps on</div>
                              <div class="line">the windy side of care. My cousin tells him in his</div>
                              <div class="line">ear that he is in her heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And so she doth, cousin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Good Lord, for alliance! Thus goes every one to the</div>
