                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">This man said, sir, that Don John, the prince's</div>
                              <div class="line">brother, was a villain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Write down Prince John a villain. Why, this is flat</div>
                              <div class="line">perjury, to call a prince's brother villain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Master constable,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray thee, fellow, peace: I do not like thy look,</div>
                              <div class="line">I promise thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sexton</div>
                              <div class="line">What heard you him say else?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, that he had received a thousand ducats of</div>
                              <div class="line">Don John for accusing the Lady Hero wrongfully.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Flat burglary as ever was committed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VERGES</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, by mass, that it is.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sexton</div>
                              <div class="line">What else, fellow?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">And that Count Claudio did mean, upon his words, to</div>
                              <div class="line">disgrace Hero before the whole assembly. and not marry her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">O villain! thou wilt be condemned into everlasting</div>
                              <div class="line">redemption for this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sexton</div>
                              <div class="line">What else?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">This is all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sexton</div>
                              <div class="line">And this is more, masters, than you can deny.</div>
                              <div class="line">Prince John is this morning secretly stolen away;</div>
                              <div class="line">Hero was in this manner accused, in this very manner</div>
                              <div class="line">refused, and upon the grief of this suddenly died.</div>
                              <div class="line">Master constable, let these men be bound, and</div>
                              <div class="line">brought to Leonato's: I will go before and show</div>
                              <div class="line">him their examination.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, let them be opinioned.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VERGES</div>
                              <div class="line">Let them be in the hands--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                              <div class="line">Off, coxcomb!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">God's my life, where's the sexton? let him write</div>
                              <div class="line">down the prince's officer coxcomb. Come, bind them.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou naughty varlet!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONRADE</div>
                              <div class="line">Away! you are an ass, you are an ass.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost thou not suspect my place? dost thou not</div>
                              <div class="line">suspect my years? O that he were here to write me</div>
                              <div class="line">down an ass! But, masters, remember that I am an</div>
                              <div class="line">ass; though it be not written down, yet forget not</div>
                              <div class="line">that I am an ass. No, thou villain, thou art full of</div>
                              <div class="line">piety, as shall be proved upon thee by good witness.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am a wise fellow, and, which is more, an officer,</div>
                              <div class="line">and, which is more, a householder, and, which is</div>
                              <div class="line">more, as pretty a piece of flesh as any is in</div>
                              <div class="line">Messina, and one that knows the law, go to; and a</div>
                              <div class="line">rich fellow enough, go to; and a fellow that hath</div>
                              <div class="line">had losses, and one that hath two gowns and every</div>
                              <div class="line">thing handsome about him. Bring him away. O that</div>
                              <div class="line">I had been writ down an ass!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Before LEONATO'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  LEONATO'S garden.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  A church.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Before LEONATO'S house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter LEONATO and ANTONIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">If you go on thus, you will kill yourself:</div>
                              <div class="line">And 'tis not wisdom thus to second grief</div>
                              <div class="line">Against yourself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray thee, cease thy counsel,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which falls into mine ears as profitless</div>
                              <div class="line">As water in a sieve: give not me counsel;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor let no comforter delight mine ear</div>
                              <div class="line">But such a one whose wrongs do suit with mine.</div>
                              <div class="line">Bring me a father that so loved his child,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose joy of her is overwhelm'd like mine,</div>
                              <div class="line">And bid him speak of patience;</div>
                              <div class="line">Measure his woe the length and breadth of mine</div>
                              <div class="line">And let it answer every strain for strain,</div>
                              <div class="line">As thus for thus and such a grief for such,</div>
                              <div class="line">In every lineament, branch, shape, and form:</div>
                              <div class="line">If such a one will smile and stroke his beard,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid sorrow wag, cry 'hem!' when he should groan,</div>
                              <div class="line">Patch grief with proverbs, make misfortune drunk</div>
                              <div class="line">With candle-wasters; bring him yet to me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I of him will gather patience.</div>
                              <div class="line">But there is no such man: for, brother, men</div>
                              <div class="line">Can counsel and speak comfort to that grief</div>
                              <div class="line">Which they themselves not feel; but, tasting it,</div>
                              <div class="line">Their counsel turns to passion, which before</div>
                              <div class="line">Would give preceptial medicine to rage,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fetter strong madness in a silken thread,</div>
                              <div class="line">Charm ache with air and agony with words:</div>
                              <div class="line">No, no; 'tis all men's office to speak patience</div>
                              <div class="line">To those that wring under the load of sorrow,</div>
                              <div class="line">But no man's virtue nor sufficiency</div>
                              <div class="line">To be so moral when he shall endure</div>
                              <div class="line">The like himself. Therefore give me no counsel:</div>
                              <div class="line">My griefs cry louder than advertisement.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Therein do men from children nothing differ.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray thee, peace. I will be flesh and blood;</div>
                              <div class="line">For there was never yet philosopher</div>
                              <div class="line">That could endure the toothache patiently,</div>
                              <div class="line">However they have writ the style of gods</div>
                              <div class="line">And made a push at chance and sufferance.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet bend not all the harm upon yourself;</div>
                              <div class="line">Make those that do offend you suffer too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">There thou speak'st reason: nay, I will do so.</div>
                              <div class="line">My soul doth tell me Hero is belied;</div>
                              <div class="line">And that shall Claudio know; so shall the prince</div>
                              <div class="line">And all of them that thus dishonour her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes the prince and Claudio hastily.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter DON PEDRO and CLAUDIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Good den, good den.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Good day to both of you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Hear you. my lords,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">We have some haste, Leonato.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Some haste, my lord! well, fare you well, my lord:</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you so hasty now? well, all is one.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, do not quarrel with us, good old man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">If he could right himself with quarreling,</div>
                              <div class="line">Some of us would lie low.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Who wrongs him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, thou dost wrong me; thou dissembler, thou:--</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, never lay thy hand upon thy sword;</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear thee not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, beshrew my hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">If it should give your age such cause of fear:</div>
                              <div class="line">In faith, my hand meant nothing to my sword.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Tush, tush, man; never fleer and jest at me:</div>
                              <div class="line">I speak not like a dotard nor a fool,</div>
                              <div class="line">As under privilege of age to brag</div>
                              <div class="line">What I have done being young, or what would do</div>
                              <div class="line">Were I not old. Know, Claudio, to thy head,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast so wrong'd mine innocent child and me</div>
                              <div class="line">That I am forced to lay my reverence by</div>
                              <div class="line">And, with grey hairs and bruise of many days,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do challenge thee to trial of a man.</div>
                              <div class="line">I say thou hast belied mine innocent child;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy slander hath gone through and through her heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">And she lies buried with her ancestors;</div>
                              <div class="line">O, in a tomb where never scandal slept,</div>
                              <div class="line">Save this of hers, framed by thy villany!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">My villany?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Thine, Claudio; thine, I say.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">You say not right, old man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll prove it on his body, if he dare,</div>
                              <div class="line">Despite his nice fence and his active practise,</div>
                              <div class="line">His May of youth and bloom of lustihood.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Away! I will not have to do with you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Canst thou so daff me? Thou hast kill'd my child:</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou kill'st me, boy, thou shalt kill a man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">He shall kill two of us, and men indeed:</div>
                              <div class="line">But that's no matter; let him kill one first;</div>
                              <div class="line">Win me and wear me; let him answer me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, follow me, boy; come, sir boy, come, follow me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir boy, I'll whip you from your foining fence;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, as I am a gentleman, I will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Content yourself. God knows I loved my niece;</div>
                              <div class="line">And she is dead, slander'd to death by villains,</div>
                              <div class="line">That dare as well answer a man indeed</div>
                              <div class="line">As I dare take a serpent by the tongue:</div>
                              <div class="line">Boys, apes, braggarts, Jacks, milksops!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother Antony,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold you content. What, man! I know them, yea,</div>
                              <div class="line">And what they weigh, even to the utmost scruple,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Scrambling, out-facing, fashion-monging boys,</div>
                              <div class="line">That lie and cog and flout, deprave and slander,</div>
                              <div class="line">Go anticly, show outward hideousness,</div>
                              <div class="line">And speak off half a dozen dangerous words,</div>
                              <div class="line">How they might hurt their enemies, if they durst;</div>
                              <div class="line">And this is all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">But, brother Antony,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, 'tis no matter:</div>
                              <div class="line">Do not you meddle; let me deal in this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Gentlemen both, we will not wake your patience.</div>
                              <div class="line">My heart is sorry for your daughter's death:</div>
                              <div class="line">But, on my honour, she was charged with nothing</div>
                              <div class="line">But what was true and very full of proof.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, my lord,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not hear you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">No? Come, brother; away! I will be heard.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And shall, or some of us will smart for it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt LEONATO and ANTONIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">See, see; here comes the man we went to seek.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter BENEDICK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, signior, what news?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Good day, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome, signior: you are almost come to part</div>
                              <div class="line">almost a fray.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">We had like to have had our two noses snapped off</div>
                              <div class="line">with two old men without teeth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Leonato and his brother. What thinkest thou? Had</div>
                              <div class="line">we fought, I doubt we should have been too young for them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">In a false quarrel there is no true valour. I came</div>
                              <div class="line">to seek you both.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">We have been up and down to seek thee; for we are</div>
                              <div class="line">high-proof melancholy and would fain have it beaten</div>
                              <div class="line">away. Wilt thou use thy wit?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">It is in my scabbard: shall I draw it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost thou wear thy wit by thy side?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Never any did so, though very many have been beside</div>
                              <div class="line">their wit. I will bid thee draw, as we do the</div>
                              <div class="line">minstrels; draw, to pleasure us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">As I am an honest man, he looks pale. Art thou</div>
                              <div class="line">sick, or angry?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">What, courage, man! What though care killed a cat,</div>
                              <div class="line">thou hast mettle enough in thee to kill care.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I shall meet your wit in the career, and you</div>
                              <div class="line">charge it against me. I pray you choose another subject.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, then, give him another staff: this last was</div>
                              <div class="line">broke cross.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">By this light, he changes more and more: I think</div>
                              <div class="line">he be angry indeed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">If he be, he knows how to turn his girdle.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall I speak a word in your ear?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">God bless me from a challenge!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to CLAUDIO</span>  You are a villain; I jest not:</div>
                              <div class="line">I will make it good how you dare, with what you</div>
                              <div class="line">dare, and when you dare. Do me right, or I will</div>
                              <div class="line">protest your cowardice. You have killed a sweet</div>
                              <div class="line">lady, and her death shall fall heavy on you. Let me</div>
                              <div class="line">hear from you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, I will meet you, so I may have good cheer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">What, a feast, a feast?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I' faith, I thank him; he hath bid me to a calf's</div>
                              <div class="line">head and a capon; the which if I do not carve most</div>
                              <div class="line">curiously, say my knife's naught. Shall I not find</div>
                              <div class="line">a woodcock too?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, your wit ambles well; it goes easily.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll tell thee how Beatrice praised thy wit the</div>
                              <div class="line">other day. I said, thou hadst a fine wit: 'True,'</div>
                              <div class="line">said she, 'a fine little one.' 'No,' said I, 'a</div>
                              <div class="line">great wit:' 'Right,' says she, 'a great gross one.'</div>
                              <div class="line">'Nay,' said I, 'a good wit:' 'Just,' said she, 'it</div>
                              <div class="line">hurts nobody.' 'Nay,' said I, 'the gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">is wise:' 'Certain,' said she, 'a wise gentleman.'</div>
                              <div class="line">'Nay,' said I, 'he hath the tongues:' 'That I</div>
                              <div class="line">believe,' said she, 'for he swore a thing to me on</div>
                              <div class="line">Monday night, which he forswore on Tuesday morning;</div>
                              <div class="line">there's a double tongue; there's two tongues.' Thus</div>
                              <div class="line">did she, an hour together, transshape thy particular</div>
                              <div class="line">virtues: yet at last she concluded with a sigh, thou</div>
                              <div class="line">wast the properest man in Italy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">For the which she wept heartily and said she cared</div>
                              <div class="line">not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, that she did: but yet, for all that, an if she</div>
                              <div class="line">did not hate him deadly, she would love him dearly:</div>
                              <div class="line">the old man's daughter told us all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">All, all; and, moreover, God saw him when he was</div>
                              <div class="line">hid in the garden.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">But when shall we set the savage bull's horns on</div>
                              <div class="line">the sensible Benedick's head?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, and text underneath, 'Here dwells Benedick the</div>
                              <div class="line">married man'?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Fare you well, boy: you know my mind. I will leave</div>
                              <div class="line">you now to your gossip-like humour: you break jests</div>
                              <div class="line">as braggarts do their blades, which God be thanked,</div>
                              <div class="line">hurt not. My lord, for your many courtesies I thank</div>
                              <div class="line">you: I must discontinue your company: your brother</div>
                              <div class="line">the bastard is fled from Messina: you have among</div>
                              <div class="line">you killed a sweet and innocent lady. For my Lord</div>
                              <div class="line">Lackbeard there, he and I shall meet: and, till</div>
                              <div class="line">then, peace be with him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">He is in earnest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">In most profound earnest; and, I'll warrant you, for</div>
                              <div class="line">the love of Beatrice.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">And hath challenged thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Most sincerely.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">What a pretty thing man is when he goes in his</div>
                              <div class="line">doublet and hose and leaves off his wit!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">He is then a giant to an ape; but then is an ape a</div>
                              <div class="line">doctor to such a man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">But, soft you, let me be: pluck up, my heart, and</div>
                              <div class="line">be sad. Did he not say, my brother was fled?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter DOGBERRY, VERGES, and the Watch, with CONRADE
and BORACHIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Come you, sir: if justice cannot tame you, she</div>
                              <div class="line">shall ne'er weigh more reasons in her balance: nay,</div>
                              <div class="line">an you be a cursing hypocrite once, you must be looked to.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">How now? two of my brother's men bound! Borachio</div>
                              <div class="line">one!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Hearken after their offence, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Officers, what offence have these men done?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, sir, they have committed false report;</div>
                              <div class="line">moreover, they have spoken untruths; secondarily,</div>
                              <div class="line">they are slanders; sixth and lastly, they have</div>
                              <div class="line">belied a lady; thirdly, they have verified unjust</div>
                              <div class="line">things; and, to conclude, they are lying knaves.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">First, I ask thee what they have done; thirdly, I</div>
                              <div class="line">ask thee what's their offence; sixth and lastly, why</div>
                              <div class="line">they are committed; and, to conclude, what you lay</div>
                              <div class="line">to their charge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Rightly reasoned, and in his own division: and, by</div>
                              <div class="line">my troth, there's one meaning well suited.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Who have you offended, masters, that you are thus</div>
                              <div class="line">bound to your answer? this learned constable is</div>
                              <div class="line">too cunning to be understood: what's your offence?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet prince, let me go no farther to mine answer:</div>
                              <div class="line">do you hear me, and let this count kill me. I have</div>
                              <div class="line">deceived even your very eyes: what your wisdoms</div>
                              <div class="line">could not discover, these shallow fools have brought</div>
                              <div class="line">to light: who in the night overheard me confessing</div>
                              <div class="line">to this man how Don John your brother incensed me</div>
                              <div class="line">to slander the Lady Hero, how you were brought into</div>
                              <div class="line">the orchard and saw me court Margaret in Hero's</div>
                              <div class="line">garments, how you disgraced her, when you should</div>
                              <div class="line">marry her: my villany they have upon record; which</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather seal with my death than repeat over</div>
                              <div class="line">to my shame. The lady is dead upon mine and my</div>
                              <div class="line">master's false accusation; and, briefly, I desire</div>
                              <div class="line">nothing but the reward of a villain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">Runs not this speech like iron through your blood?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I have drunk poison whiles he utter'd it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">But did my brother set thee on to this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, and paid me richly for the practise of it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">He is composed and framed of treachery:</div>
                              <div class="line">And fled he is upon this villany.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet Hero! now thy image doth appear</div>
                              <div class="line">In the rare semblance that I loved it first.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, bring away the plaintiffs: by this time our</div>
                              <div class="line">sexton hath reformed Signior Leonato of the matter:</div>
                              <div class="line">and, masters, do not forget to specify, when time</div>
                              <div class="line">and place shall serve, that I am an ass.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VERGES</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, here comes master Signior Leonato, and the</div>
                              <div class="line">Sexton too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter LEONATO and ANTONIO, with the Sexton</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Which is the villain? let me see his eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, when I note another man like him,</div>
                              <div class="line">I may avoid him: which of these is he?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">If you would know your wronger, look on me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Art thou the slave that with thy breath hast kill'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine innocent child?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, even I alone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">No, not so, villain; thou beliest thyself:</div>
                              <div class="line">Here stand a pair of honourable men;</div>
                              <div class="line">A third is fled, that had a hand in it.</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank you, princes, for my daughter's death:</div>
                              <div class="line">Record it with your high and worthy deeds:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twas bravely done, if you bethink you of it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I know not how to pray your patience;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet I must speak. Choose your revenge yourself;</div>
                              <div class="line">Impose me to what penance your invention</div>
                              <div class="line">Can lay upon my sin: yet sinn'd I not</div>
                              <div class="line">But in mistaking.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">By my soul, nor I:</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet, to satisfy this good old man,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would bend under any heavy weight</div>
                              <div class="line">That he'll enjoin me to.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot bid you bid my daughter live;</div>
                              <div class="line">That were impossible: but, I pray you both,</div>
                              <div class="line">Possess the people in Messina here</div>
                              <div class="line">How innocent she died; and if your love</div>
                              <div class="line">Can labour ought in sad invention,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hang her an epitaph upon her tomb</div>
                              <div class="line">And sing it to her bones, sing it to-night:</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow morning come you to my house,</div>
                              <div class="line">And since you could not be my son-in-law,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be yet my nephew: my brother hath a daughter,</div>
                              <div class="line">Almost the copy of my child that's dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">And she alone is heir to both of us:</div>
                              <div class="line">Give her the right you should have given her cousin,</div>
                              <div class="line">And so dies my revenge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">O noble sir,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your over-kindness doth wring tears from me!</div>
                              <div class="line">I do embrace your offer; and dispose</div>
                              <div class="line">For henceforth of poor Claudio.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow then I will expect your coming;</div>
                              <div class="line">To-night I take my leave. This naughty man</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall face to face be brought to Margaret,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who I believe was pack'd in all this wrong,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hired to it by your brother.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BORACHIO</div>
                              <div class="line">No, by my soul, she was not,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor knew not what she did when she spoke to me,</div>
                              <div class="line">But always hath been just and virtuous</div>
                              <div class="line">In any thing that I do know by her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Moreover, sir, which indeed is not under white and</div>
                              <div class="line">black, this plaintiff here, the offender, did call</div>
                              <div class="line">me ass: I beseech you, let it be remembered in his</div>
                              <div class="line">punishment. And also, the watch heard them talk of</div>
                              <div class="line">one Deformed: they say be wears a key in his ear and</div>
                              <div class="line">a lock hanging by it, and borrows money in God's</div>
                              <div class="line">name, the which he hath used so long and never paid</div>
                              <div class="line">that now men grow hard-hearted and will lend nothing</div>
                              <div class="line">for God's sake: pray you, examine him upon that point.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank thee for thy care and honest pains.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Your worship speaks like a most thankful and</div>
                              <div class="line">reverend youth; and I praise God for you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">There's for thy pains.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">God save the foundation!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, I discharge thee of thy prisoner, and I thank thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOGBERRY</div>
                              <div class="line">I leave an arrant knave with your worship; which I</div>
                              <div class="line">beseech your worship to correct yourself, for the</div>
                              <div class="line">example of others. God keep your worship! I wish</div>
                              <div class="line">your worship well; God restore you to health! I</div>
                              <div class="line">humbly give you leave to depart; and if a merry</div>
                              <div class="line">meeting may be wished, God prohibit it! Come, neighbour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt DOGBERRY and VERGES</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">Until to-morrow morning, lords, farewell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, my lords: we look for you to-morrow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DON PEDRO</div>
                              <div class="line">We will not fail.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLAUDIO</div>
                              <div class="line">To-night I'll mourn with Hero.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEONATO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To the Watch</span>  Bring you these fellows on. We'll</div>
                              <div class="line">talk with Margaret,</div>
                              <div class="line">How her acquaintance grew with this lewd fellow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt, severally</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  LEONATO'S garden.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter BENEDICK and MARGARET, meeting</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray thee, sweet Mistress Margaret, deserve well at</div>
                              <div class="line">my hands by helping me to the speech of Beatrice.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you then write me a sonnet in praise of my beauty?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">In so high a style, Margaret, that no man living</div>
                              <div class="line">shall come over it; for, in most comely truth, thou</div>
                              <div class="line">deservest it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">To have no man come over me! why, shall I always</div>
                              <div class="line">keep below stairs?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy wit is as quick as the greyhound's mouth; it catches.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">And yours as blunt as the fencer's foils, which hit,</div>
                              <div class="line">but hurt not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">A most manly wit, Margaret; it will not hurt a</div>
                              <div class="line">woman: and so, I pray thee, call Beatrice: I give</div>
                              <div class="line">thee the bucklers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Give us the swords; we have bucklers of our own.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">If you use them, Margaret, you must put in the</div>
                              <div class="line">pikes with a vice; and they are dangerous weapons for maids.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, I will call Beatrice to you, who I think hath legs.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore will come.</div>
                              <p>Exit MARGARET</p>
                              <p>Sings</p>
                              <div class="line">The god of love,</div>
                              <div class="line">That sits above,</div>
                              <div class="line">And knows me, and knows me,</div>
                              <div class="line">How pitiful I deserve,--</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean in singing; but in loving, Leander the good</div>
                              <div class="line">swimmer, Troilus the first employer of panders, and</div>
                              <div class="line">a whole bookful of these quondam carpet-mangers,</div>
                              <div class="line">whose names yet run smoothly in the even road of a</div>
                              <div class="line">blank verse, why, they were never so truly turned</div>
                              <div class="line">over and over as my poor self in love. Marry, I</div>
                              <div class="line">cannot show it in rhyme; I have tried: I can find</div>
                              <div class="line">out no rhyme to 'lady' but 'baby,' an innocent</div>
                              <div class="line">rhyme; for 'scorn,' 'horn,' a hard rhyme; for,</div>
                              <div class="line">'school,' 'fool,' a babbling rhyme; very ominous</div>
                              <div class="line">endings: no, I was not born under a rhyming planet,</div>
                              <div class="line">nor I cannot woo in festival terms.</div>
                              <p>Enter BEATRICE</p>
                              <div class="line">Sweet Beatrice, wouldst thou come when I called thee?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, signior, and depart when you bid me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">O, stay but till then!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">'Then' is spoken; fare you well now: and yet, ere</div>
                              <div class="line">I go, let me go with that I came; which is, with</div>
                              <div class="line">knowing what hath passed between you and Claudio.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Only foul words; and thereupon I will kiss thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">Foul words is but foul wind, and foul wind is but</div>
                              <div class="line">foul breath, and foul breath is noisome; therefore I</div>
                              <div class="line">will depart unkissed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast frighted the word out of his right sense,</div>
                              <div class="line">so forcible is thy wit. But I must tell thee</div>
                              <div class="line">plainly, Claudio undergoes my challenge; and either</div>
                              <div class="line">I must shortly hear from him, or I will subscribe</div>
                              <div class="line">him a coward. And, I pray thee now, tell me for</div>
                              <div class="line">which of my bad parts didst thou first fall in love with me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">For them all together; which maintained so politic</div>
                              <div class="line">a state of evil that they will not admit any good</div>
                              <div class="line">part to intermingle with them. But for which of my</div>
                              <div class="line">good parts did you first suffer love for me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENEDICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Suffer love! a good epithet! I do suffer love</div>
                              <div class="line">indeed, for I love thee against my will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEATRICE</div>
                              <div class="line">In spite of your heart, I think; alas, poor heart!</div>
